'''Beram Kayal''' (or Biram Keyal,<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/jul/29/celtic-transfer-israeli-midfielder-biram-kayal Celtic complete signing of Israeli midfielder Biram Kayal] guardian.co.uk, 29 July 2010</ref> {{lang-ar|بيرم كيال}}, {{lang-he-n|בירם כיאל}}; born 2 May 1988) is an [[Arab-Israeli]] professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]] for [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] and the [[Israel national football team|Israel national team]]. He has been a full international since 2008, and has 39 senior [[cap (sports)|caps]].
Kayal joined [[Maccabi Haifa F.C.|Maccabi Haifa]] in 2002 and made his professional debut in 2006 at the age of 18. He made 125 appearances and scored eight goals before moving to Celtic in 2010. He has received plaudits from many Scottish football pundits and was named the [[Scottish Premier League monthly awards|SPL player of the month]] for January 2011.<ref name=PoMJan11/> In January 2015, he joined Brighton.
==Club career==
===Maccabi Haifa=== Kayal started his career as a striker in the various Youth teams of Maccabi Haifa and scored many goals before taking on the role of a midfielder. Despite only being 16 years old at the time, he moved up to the Maccabi Haifa under-19 team for the 2004–05 campaign and excelled as part of the team that won a League and Cup double. Kayal was named the League's Outstanding Player.
He made his first-team debut for Maccabi Haifa at the end of the 2005–06 season in a 2–1 win over [[Maccabi Petah Tikva F.C.|Maccabi Petah Tikva]] which sealed Maccabi's third League title in a row at the age of 17 making two appearances that season. In the 2006–07 season, he made six appearances in all competitions, but took on the role of captain of the under-19 team that won another League and Cup double. He scored a hat-trick in a league win against [[Beitar Jerusalem F.C.|Beitar Jerusalem]].
In the 2007–08 season Kayal became a first team regular featuring 36 times in the first-team. After that he became an integral part of the team and enjoyed success in subsequent seasons winning the [[Israeli Premier League|Premier League]] and [[Toto Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.mhaifa.co.il/TheClub/Player.asp?id=462/07/PRIMAGIORVIAREGGIO.shtml |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20110721140200/http://www.mhaifa.co.il/TheClub/Player.asp?id=462%2F07%2FPRIMAGIORVIAREGGIO.shtml |dead-url = yes |archive-date = 21 July 2011 |title = Biram Kayal |publisher = Maccabi Haifa FC |date = 1 June 2010 |accessdate = 1 June 2010 |language = Hebrew |df = dmy-all }}</ref>
During the [[Torneo di Viareggio 2007|2007 Torneo di Viareggio]] youth tournament in Italy, Kayal was praised by the Italian press for a [[Man of the match]] performance against their counterparts from [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]].<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Altro_Calcio/Primo_Piano/2007/02_Febbraio/07/PRIMAGIORVIAREGGIO.shtml |title = Vincono Inter e Maccabi |publisher = Gazetta dello Sport |date = 7 February 2007 |accessdate = 2 August 2007 |language=Italian }}</ref> Both ''[[Corriere della Sera]]'' and ''Gazzetta dello Sport'' seemed to be astonished to learn that he was an Arab on an Israeli team and took a great amount of time to learn more about him.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://maccabi-haifafc.walla.co.il/ts.cgi?tsscript=item&id=7193 |script-title = he:ה"גזטה דלי ספורט" התלהב מחיפה: פיורנטינה טבעה בדממה |publisher = Maccabi Haifa FC |date = 8 February 2007 |accessdate = 2 August 2007 |language = Hebrew }}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
===Celtic=== [[File:Beram Kayal 2012.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Kayal playing for Celtic, 2012]] On 29 July 2010, Kayal signed a four-year deal with [[Scottish Premier League]] side [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]]<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/news/Kayal-signs-for-Celtic-article541139.html|title=Kayal signs for Celtic|work=MirrorFootball|publisher=Trinity Mirror|date=29 July 2010|accessdate=27 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Celtic sign Israel midfielder Beram Kayal|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/celtic/8849942.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 July 2010 | date=29 July 2010}}</ref> and was given the number 33 shirt.<ref name=CeltProf>[http://www.celticfc.net/player.php?id=33 Beram Kayal] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110514194441/http://www.celticfc.net/player.php?id=33 |date=14 May 2011 }} Celtic FC</ref>
Kayal made his debut for Celtic against [[FC Utrecht]] on 19 August 2010 and showed his full potential by getting off to the best possible start, setting up the opening goal of the game for [[Efraín Juárez]] and winning the [[Man of the Match]] award.<ref>[http://www.celticfc.net/newsstory?item=255 Dominant Celts cruise to victory] Celtic FC, 19 August 2010</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/aug/19/celtic-utrecht-europa-league Beram Kayal makes instant impact as Celtic build cushion over Utrecht] guardian.co.uk, 19 August 2010</ref> In September 2010 he suffered a setback and was out of action for three months due to a hernia injury which required surgery.<ref>[http://sport.stv.tv/football/scottish-premier/celtic/201545-kayal-sidelined-for-two-months-with-hernia-injury/ Kayal sidelined for two months with hernia injury] STV Sport, 7 October 2010</ref><ref>[http://www.setanta.com/ien/Articles/2010/12/24/Preview-Celtic-v-St-Johnstone/gnid-84246/ Preview: Celtic v St Johnstone] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120329060130/http://www.setanta.com/ien/Articles/2010/12/24/Preview-Celtic-v-St-Johnstone/gnid-84246/ |date=29 March 2012 }} Setanta Sports, 24 December 2010</ref> He made his return as a substitute on 26 December against [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]],<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9318611.stm Celtic 2 – 0 St Johnstone] BBC Sport, 26 December 2010</ref> and was restored to the starting line-up in a 2–0 win over [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] at [[Ibrox Stadium|Ibrox]] on 2 January 2011.<ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1343456/Rangers-0-Celtic-2-Georgios-Samaras-double-Bhoys-points-clear.html Rangers 0 Celtic 2: Georgios Samaras at the double as Bhoys see off Old Firm rivals to move four points clear] Mail Online, 2 January 2011</ref>
His performances won him the [[Scottish Premier League monthly awards|SPL Player of the Month award]] for January 2011,<ref name=PoMJan11>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/celtic/9395657.stm Celtic's Beram Kayal named player of the month] BBC Sport, 12 February 2011</ref> and the praise of Celtic manager [[Neil Lennon]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/celtic/9396345.stm Celtic boss Neil Lennon praises Beram Kayal's workrate] BBC Sport, 13 February 2011</ref> His determination and competitive attitude played a key part in his side's success in his [[2010–11 in Scottish football|first season in Scottish football]].<ref>[http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/spl/celtic/kayal-has-battled-his-way-to-prominence-at-celtic-1.1081635 Kayal has battled his way to prominence at Celtic] Herald Scotland, 25 January 2011</ref><ref>[http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/spl/celtic/impressed-you-ve-seen-nothing-yet-of-kayal-1.1089297 Impressed? You’ve seen nothing yet of Kayal] Herald Scotland, 9 March 2011</ref> On 9 April 2011, Kayal captained the side in a 1–0 win over [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9450584.stm Celtic 1 – 0 St Mirren] BBC Sport, 9 April 2011</ref> He scored his first goal for [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in a 1–0 SPL win over [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]] on 12 April 2011.<ref>[https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/latest/2011/04/12/kayal-extends-hoops-lead-115875-23057259/ Kayal extends Hoops lead] Mirror.co.uk, 12 April 2011</ref> His first home goal was a long range effort against [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] on 1 May 2011.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9470834.stm Celtic 4 – 1 Dundee Utd] BBC Sport, 1 May 2011</ref> On 4 May, Kayal had to be taken off in the second half of an SPL match against [[Inverness Caledonian Thistle F.C.|Inverness Caledonian Thistle]] because of suspected concussion<ref>[http://www.u.tv/Sport/Lennon-rips-into-defence-as-Celtic-suffer-Inverness-defeat/0b46de6e-4d53-47e8-8d78-32a278c64f3c Lennon rips into defence as Celtic suffer Inverness defeat] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120928231931/http://www.u.tv/Sport/Lennon-rips-into-defence-as-Celtic-suffer-Inverness-defeat/0b46de6e-4d53-47e8-8d78-32a278c64f3c |date=28 September 2012 }} UTV Sport, 5 May 2011</ref> after a collision with [[Ross Tokely]].<ref name=SeasonOver>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13295615.stm Beram Kayal's season is over following wrist injury] BBC Sport, 6 May 2011</ref> Kayal sustained a fractured wrist in the same incident and subsequently missed the rest of the [[2010–11 in Scottish football|2010–11 season]].<ref name=SeasonOver/><ref>[http://sport.scotsman.com/sport/Beram-Kayal-to-miss-Celtic39s.6763360.jp Beram Kayal to miss Celtic's title run-in] Scotsman.com, 6 May 2011</ref>
Kayal captained Celtic for the second time on 10 September 2011, against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]] in the SPL, leading the team to a 4–0 victory at [[Celtic Park]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19764,11065_3407484,00.html | publisher= Sky Sports | title=Hoops hammer sloppy Steelmen | date=10 September 2011}}</ref> He was made captain while [[Scott Brown (footballer, born June 1985)|Scott Brown]] was out with an ankle injury.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/football/spl/celtic/2011/09/17/celtic-ace-beram-kayal-i-was-proud-to-be-captain-but-we-know-how-important-scott-brown-is-86908-23426464/ | work= Daily Record | title=Celtic ace Beram Kayal: I was proud to be captain but we know how important Scott Brown is | date=17 September 2011}}</ref>
Kayal suffered ankle ligament damage against Rangers on 28 December 2011 after a tackle by [[Lee McCulloch]] and was stretchered off with 13 minutes to play.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://local.stv.tv/glasgow/magazine/292612-celtics-beram-kayal-may-not-play-again-this-season/ | archive-url=https://archive.is/20130418190538/http://local.stv.tv/glasgow/magazine/292612-celtics-beram-kayal-may-not-play-again-this-season/ | dead-url=yes | archive-date=18 April 2013 | publisher=STV | title=Celtic's Beram Kayal may not play again this season | date=6 January 2012 }}</ref> Celtic won the match 1–0 which sent them top of the SPL table.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/celtic/8987104/Celtic-turn-title-race-round-now-they-have-to-finish-Rangers-off.html | work=The Telegraph | first=Roddy | last=Forsyth | title=Celtic turn title race round, now they have to finish Rangers off | date=1 January 2012}}</ref> The injury put Kayal out of action for over four months<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17705179 | publisher= BBC Sport| title=Beram Kayal's return softens James Forrest blow for Celtic | date=13 April 2012}}</ref> and he returned to the side only in the last game of the season, a 5–0 win over [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17973176 | publisher= BBC Sport | first=Colin | last=Moffat | title=Celtic 5–0 Hearts | date=15 May 2012}}</ref> Later, Kayal accused McCulloch of deliberately injuring him that he "have not forgotten that for a moment."<ref>{{cite news|title=Celtic midfielder Beram Kayal slams Scottish football for 'lack of technique' & accuses Lee McCulloch of deliberately crocking him|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/celtic-midfielder-beram-kayal-slams-3338953|publisher=Daily Record|date=2 April 2014|accessdate=10 April 2014}}</ref>
In the 2012 season, Kayal obtained European nationality and played an important role for the team during the Scottish League. On 22 October 2013 he scored his first goal in the [[UEFA Champions League]] against [[AFC Ajax]] in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2472133/Celtic-2-Ajax-1-Neil-Lennons-10-men-seal-famous-victory.html|title= Lennon's 10 men seal victory after goals from Forrest and Kayal|date=22 October 2013|work=Daily Mail|accessdate=23 October 2013}}</ref>
===Brighton & Hove Albion=== On 23 January 2015, Kayal signed for [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on a two-and-a-half-year deal, for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30961756 | work=BBC | title= Brighton sign Celtic midfielder Beram Kayal | date=23 January 2015}}</ref> He made his debut on 7 February, scoring a consolation goal for Brighton in a 2–3 defeat at home against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Shergold|first1=Adam|title=Brighton 2–3 Nottingham Forest: Danny Collins, Henri Lansbury and Ben Osborn net as Dougie Freedman earns first win as boss|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2943955/Brighton-2-3-Nottingham-Forest-Danny-Collins-Henri-Lansbury-Ben-Osborn-net-Dougie-Freedman-earns-win-boss.html|publisher=Mail Online|accessdate=7 February 2015|date=7 February 2015}}</ref> On 18 August, he scored within 14 seconds away to [[Huddersfield Town F.C|Huddersfield Town]], albeit in a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite news|title=Huddersfield 1–1 Brighton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33857651|accessdate=19 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 August 2015}}</ref> Brighton narrowly missed out on automatic promotion where Kayal played 43 games and scoring 2 goals in the league in the [[2015-16 Football League Championship|2015-16]] season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36176217|title=Middlesbrough 1-1 Brighton & Hove Albion - BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 7 May 2016|accessdate= 7 May 2016}}</ref> Brighton were to face another season in the Championship after losing to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]] on aggregate in the play offs where Kayal played in both matches for the Albion.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36244725|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1-1 Sheffield Wednesday (1-3 agg) - BBC sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 16 May 2016|accessdate= 16 May 2016}}</ref>
On 7 January 2017 Kayal played in his first ever [[FA Cup]] match where he scored in the 2-0 home win over [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|MK Dons]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38474505|title=FA Cup: Brighton 2-0 Milton Keynes Dons - BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 7 January 2017|accessdate= 7 January 2017}}</ref> On 17 April 2017 Kayal played in the 2-1 home win over [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] which secured automatic promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39549523|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 2-1 Wigan Athletic - BBC sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 17 April 2017|accessdate= 17 April 2017}}</ref>
Kayal broke his leg in pre season in a friendly match against [[Atlético Madrid]] where he was sidelined for 10 weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15463996.kayal-injury-could-force-albion-back-into-midfield-market/|title=Beram Kayal injury could force Albion back into midfield market|publisher=The Argus|date= 10 August 2017|accessdate= 10 August 2017}}</ref> Kayal made his Premier League debut on 13 December 2017 in a 2-0 away defeat to [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Spurs]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42247117|title=Tottenham Hotspur 2-0 Brighton & Hove Albion - BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 13 December 2017|accessdate= 13 December 2017}}</ref> Kayal went on to make 18 more Premier League appearances and played in the 1-0 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester Utd]] which secured Albion's Premier League status.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43916611|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Manchester United – BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 May 2018}}</ref>
Kayal signed a one year contract extension on 28 September 2018 that keeps him at the Sussex club until June 2020.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11741/11511014/brighton-midfielder-beram-kayal-signs-one-year-contract-extension|title=Brighton midfielder Beram Kayal signs one-year contract extension|publisher=Sky Sports|date=28 September 2018}}</ref> Kayal scored his first ever Premier League goal in a 1-0 away win against [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle]] on 20 October 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45847415|title=Newcastle United 0–1 Brighton & Hove Albion – BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 October 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Throughout his career, Kayal has played many [[Israel national football team]] matches as first line-up.<ref name=Boker>{{cite news |title=Holding Triumvirate |first=Moshe |last=Boker |url=http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/sports/soccer-holding-triumvirate-1.351228 |work=Ha'aretz |date=23 March 2011 |accessdate=8 June 2011}}</ref> He made his full international debut for [[Israel national football team|Israel]] against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] on 6 September 2008.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20120518010314/http://eng.football.org.il/NationalTeam/Pages/NationalTeamPlayerDetails.aspx?PLAYER_ID=9586&NATIONAL_TEAM_ID=3 Kayal Beram] Israel Football Association</ref>
He scored his first international goal, in a [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|Euro 2012 qualifying]] win over [[Latvia national football team|Latvia]] on 26 March 2011.<ref>[http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro2012/matches/season=2012/round=15171/match=2002259/postmatch/report/index.html Israel indebted to Kayal against Latvia] UEFA.com, 26 March 2011</ref>
===International goals=== :''Scores and results list Israel's goal tally first.''<ref name="NFT">{{cite web|url=http://www.national-football-teams.com/player/27420/Biram_Kiyal.html|title=Kiyal, Biram|publisher=National Football Teams|accessdate=2 May 2017}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" ! Goal !!Date !! Venue !! Opponent !! Score !! Result !! Competition |- | 1. ||26 March 2011 || [[Bloomfield Stadium]], [[Tel Aviv]], Israel || {{fb|Latvia}} ||align=center | '''2'''–1 || align=center | 2–1 || [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group F|UEFA Euro 2012 qualification]] |- | 2. ||21 November 2018 || [[Hampden Park]], [[Glasgow]], Scotland || {{fb|Scotland}} ||align=center | '''1'''–0 || align=center | 2–3 || [[2018–19 UEFA Nations League C]] |}
==Style of play== Kayal is a [[central midfielder]] but he is capable of performing various different roles within the position. He can play as a [[defensive midfielder]], sitting in front of the back four and stifling the opposition or as a [[box-to-box mid]]fielder, protecting the defenders as well as supporting the forwards. Although he is more renowned for his defensive capabilities than attacking, he is still able to contribute well to going forward.<ref name="STVtransfer" />
Kayal is a tenacious, hard working midfielder, known for high stamina level, aggressive tackling and combative edge, he also has great passing ability and quick feet.<ref name="STVtransfer">[http://sport.stv.tv/football/scottish-premier/celtic/189093-kayal-completes-celtic-transfer/ Biram Kayal completes Celtic transfer] STV Sport, 29 July 2010</ref><ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/mar/12/beram-kayal-celtic-scottish-premier-league Coveted Beram Kayal in no hurry to leave Celtic with treble in sight] guardian.co.uk, 12 March 2011</ref> Ex-Celtic and [[Israel national football team|Israel]] midfielder [[Eyal Berkovic]], described him as being: "Perfect for British football. He is strong technically, very aware but really competitive...He will have no problem adapting to the style in Scotland – he will love the speed and aggression.<ref>{{cite news | url = http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/football/spl/celtic/2010/07/31/beram-kayal-won-t-flop-at-celtic-like-i-did-insists-eyal-berkovic-86908-22453480/ | title = Beram Kayal won't flop at Celtic like I did, insists Eyal Berkovic | work = Daily Record | date = 31 July 2010 | accessdate = 23 November 2011}}</ref>
==Personal life== Kayal is [[Muslim]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/nov/21/beram-kayal-tomer-hemed-israelis-brighton|title=Beram Kayal and Tomer Hemed: Israelis united in promoting Brighton’s cause|first=Jacob|last=Steinberg|date=21 November 2015|publisher=|via=www.theguardian.com}}</ref>

= 7 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | club-update = 14:30, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:22, 4 September 2014 (UTC) }} '''Jürgen Leonardo Locadia''' (born 7 November 1993) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] or [[Forward (association football)|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Locadia, who is of Curaçaoan descent,[http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/15198/8544289/sky-sports-scout-jurgen-locadia Sky Sports Scout – Jurgen Locadia]. [[SkySports]]. 21 May 2014. was born in [[Emmen, Netherlands|Emmen]], [[Netherlands]], and began playing football with the club [[:nl:VV Bargeres|VV Bargeres]], before being discovered by the youth team of [[FC Emmen]]. When he was offered to play for [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]], he and his whole family settled in [[Tilburg]].{{cite web|url=http://blogs.rnw.nl/koninkrijksspelen2009/2009/07/16/jurgen-locadia-droomt-van-internationale-voetbalcarriere/|title=Jurgen Locadia droomt van internationale voetbalcarrière|first=Gijs|last=van den Heivel|publisher=Radio Nederland Wereldomroep|date=16 July 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090812082931/http://blogs.rnw.nl/koninkrijksspelen2009/2009/07/16/jurgen-locadia-droomt-van-internationale-voetbalcarriere/|archivedate=12 August 2009}} In 2010, he moved on to [[PSV Eindhoven]], and in 2012 at the age of 18 he was offered a professional contract. ===PSV Eindhoven=== [[File:Jurgen Locadia.jpg|left|thumb|160px|Locadia during his official debut match for PSV]] On 21 September 2011, Locadia made his first appearance for PSV in a [[KNVB Cup]] match against [[VVSB]]. He entered as a substitute for [[Tim Matavž]] in the 72nd minute. In the 80th minute, he scored PSV's sixth goal in the 8–0 win.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reached-third-round-with-a-08-win.htm|title=PSV reached third round with a 0–8 win|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110925050252/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reached-third-round-with-a-08-win.htm|archivedate=25 September 2011|df=dmy-all}} Locadia made his first start for PSV in the following round against [[FC Lisse]] on 27 October 2011.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Cup-round-of-16-with-30-win-over-FC-Lisse.htm|title=PSV reach KNVB Cup round of 16 with 3–0 win over FC Lisse|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111222072510/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Cup-round-of-16-with-30-win-over-FC-Lisse.htm|archivedate=22 December 2011|df=dmy-all}} At the beginning of the 2012–13 season, Locadia was handed the shirt number 19 for the first team. He made his first appearance of the season as a starter in a KNVB Cup match against [[Achilles '29]] on 27 September 2012. He scored the second goal in the 3–0 win over the [[Topklasse|third-tier team]].{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-progress-after-win-over-Achilles29.htm|title=PSV progress after win over Achilles'29|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120929030958/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-progress-after-win-over-Achilles29.htm|archivedate=29 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} On 30 September 2012, Locadia made his [[Eredivisie]] debut against [[VVV-Venlo]]. He entered the pitch in Venlo as a substitute in the 68th minute, and with only 22 minutes left in the game he managed to score three goals in the 6–0 win over VVV-Venlo.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-hit-tenman-VVVVenlo-for-six.htm|title=PSV hit ten-man VVV-Venlo for six|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121110040156/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-hit-tenman-VVVVenlo-for-six.htm|archivedate=10 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} He became the first player to score a [[hat-trick]] in his Eredivisie debut since [[Harald Berg]] scored three goals in his debut game on 10 August 1969.[http://www.vi.nl/achtergronden/speler/228569/Debutant-Locadia-in-de-voetsporen-van-ADOspits-Berg.htm Debutant Locadia in de voetsporen van ADO-spits Berg], VI.nl, 30 september 2012 A week after his debut hat-trick, Locadia was promoted to the first team and signed a new five-year contract with PSV which will keep him at the club until 2017.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/Jurgen-Locadia-signs-new-contract.htm|title=Jürgen Locadia signs new contract|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130126033121/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/Jurgen-Locadia-signs-new-contract.htm|archivedate=26 January 2013|df=dmy-all}} On 27 February 2013, he scored three goals in a 3–0 win over [[PEC Zwolle]] in the KNVB Cup semi-final.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Beker-final-after-03-win-over-PEC-Zwolle.htm|title=PSV reach KNVB Beker final after 0–3 win over PEC Zwolle|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130703125153/http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Beker-final-after-03-win-over-PEC-Zwolle.htm|archivedate=3 July 2013|df=dmy-all}} Locadia began the [[2017–18 Eredivisie|2017–18]] season for PSV in good form, scoring nine goals and assisting six in 15 league games, including four goals in a 7–1 victory against [[FC Utrecht]]. He played regularly until he sustained an injury on 11 December. {{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/utrecht-vs-psv/372840|title=FC Utrecht 1–7 PSV Eindhoven|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 January 2018}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11741/11212902/brighton-closing-on-jurgen-locadia-deal-from-psv-eindhoven|title=Brighton closing on Locadia deal|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 January 2018}}. ===Brighton & Hove Albion=== On 18 January 2018, [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] agreed a reported £15 million total fee with PSV for the transfer of Locadia, with £10 million being paid upfront along with £5 million in add-ons.{{Cite news|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15865537.Albion_closing_in_on_prolific_PSV_striker_Jurgen_Locadia/|title=Brighton and Hove Albion close in on Jurgen Locadia from PSV Eindhoven|publisher=The Argus|author=Andy Naylor|date=18 January 2018}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5286295/Brighton-close-14m-deal-PSVs-Jurgen-Locadia.html|title=PSV Eindhoven forward Jurgen Locadia set for Brighton medical ahead of proposed £14million switch|publisher=Daily Mail|author=Sami Mokbel|date=18 January 2018}} He signed a four-and-a-half-year contract with ''the'' ''Seagulls'' the next day, and was giving the number 25 shirt. (He now wears the number 9 shirt).{{Cite news|url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/january/albion-break-transfer-record-for-striker/|title=Albion break transfer record for striker|publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion Football Club|date=19 January 2018}} He reunites with former PSV teammate [[Davy Pröpper]], who joined Brighton in the 2017 summer transfer window. On 17 February 2018, Locadia scored on his Brighton debut in a 3–1 FA Cup fifth round win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].{{cite web|title=Jürgen Locadia scores on debut in Brighton stroll against Coventry |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/17/brighton-coventry-city-fa-cup-match-report|date=17 February 2018|accessdate=17 February 2017|publisher=[[The Guardian]]}} He scored on his Premier League debut a week later on 24 February, netting from close range in the 90th minute of a 4–1 victory against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], after coming on as a second-half substitute.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43094255|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 4–1 Swansea City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 February 2018}} Locadia scored his first goal of the season in a 1–0 win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] in which he played the whole match.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46656878 |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1-0 Everton: Locadia strike proves decisive for hosts - BBC Sport |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 December 2018 |accessdate=29 December 2018}} On 17 March 2019, Locadia scored in the [[2018-19 FA Cup|FA Cup]] quarter final away against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]]. His goal gave Brighton a lifeline putting them just a goal behind at [[The Den]]. A few minutes later [[Solly March]] scored a last gasp free kick making it 2–2 and to take it to extra time. The game stayed level throughout extra time and Brighton went to win on penalties 5–4 (in which Locadia and March both scored in) to take them to [[Wembley]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47512116|title=Millwall 2–2 Brighton (pens 4-5): Brighton into FA Cup semi-finals on penalties - BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 March 2019}} ==International career== Locadia received his first call-up to the senior [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] squad in November 2015.{{cite news|title=Locadia called into Netherlands squad for first time|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/locadia-called-into-netherlands-squad-for-first-time/|accessdate=22 March 2016|publisher=football-oranje.com|date=15 November 2015}} He was called up again in March 2016 for friendlies against [[France national football team|France]] and [[England national football team|England]],{{cite news|title=Arjen Robben pulls out of Holland squad to face France and England with a thigh injury|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3497216/Arjen-Robben-pulls-Holland-squad-face-France-England-thigh-injury.html|accessdate=18 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=17 March 2016}} however he had to pull out with an injury.{{cite news|title=Karsdorp called up as four pull out of Netherlands squad|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/karsdorp-called-four-pull-netherlands-squad/|accessdate=22 March 2016|publisher=football-oranje.com|date=20 March 2016}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 17 March 2019|{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/jurgen-locadia/158589/|title=Netherlands – J. 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19:54, 13 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Florin Andone''' ({{IPA-ro|floˈrin anˈdone}}; born 11 April 1993) is a Romanian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for English [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] and the [[Romania national football team|Romania national team]].
Raised in Spain, he began playing in the country's lower divisions before making his professional debut for [[Córdoba CF|Córdoba]] at the age of 21. In 2016, he joined [[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo La Coruña]], and two years later he signed for [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] of the Premier League.
Andone earned his first full cap for Romania in June 2015 and was selected for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Botoșani]], Andone moved to [[Vinaròs]] in the [[Valencian Community]] in 2005, aged 12, to join his mother after his father died in a car accident. He immediately joined [[Vinaròs CF]]'s youth setup, and in 2008 moved to [[CD Castellón|Castellón]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ziare.com/botosani/stiri-sport/florin-andone-botosaneanul-care-a-uimit-spania-1997387 |title=Florin Andone, botosaneanul care a uimit Spania!|trans-title=Florin Andone, the Botoșani native who stunned Spain! |publisher=Ziare |language=ro |date=15 February 2011 |accessdate=22 March 2015}}</ref>
Andone made his senior debut on 16 January 2011, coming on as a late [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for [[Pau Franch]] in a 1–1 away draw against [[Orihuela CF|Orihuela]] for the [[Segunda División B]] championship.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.orihueladigital.es/orihuela/deportes/orihuela_cf_castellon_160111.htm |title=El Orihuela CF empató 1–1 frente al CD Castellón y mantiene su posición de líder|trans-title=Orihuela CF drew 1–1 against CD Castellón and maintains its leader position |publisher=Orihuela Digital |language=es |date=16 January 2011 |accessdate=22 March 2015}}</ref> He appeared in three further matches for the club, which eventually [[2010–11 Segunda División B|suffered relegation]].
On 2 June 2011, Andone joined [[Villarreal CF|Villarreal]], returning to youth football.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/noticias/la-cronica-de-castellon/dos-juveniles-villarreal_18244.html |title=Dos juveniles, al Villarreal|trans-title=Two youth players, to Villarreal |publisher=El Periódico Mediterráneo |language=es |date=2 June 2011 |accessdate=4 December 2014}}</ref> He also appeared with [[Villarreal CF C|the C-team]] during the campaign, with the side in [[Tercera División]].
On 15 August 2013, Andone was loaned to the third level's [[CD Atlético Baleares|Atlético Baleares]], in a [[2013–14 Segunda División B|season]]-long deal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.deportebalear.com/2013/08/15/florin-andone-del-villarreal-nuevo-jugador-del-at-baleares/ |title=Florin Andone del Villarreal nuevo jugador del At. Baleares|trans-title=Florin Andone from Villarreal new player of At. Baleares |publisher=Deporte Balear |language=es |date=15 August 2013 |accessdate=4 December 2014}}</ref> He finished the campaign with 12 goals in 34 matches, with the [[Balearic Islands|Balearic]] outfit being one point shy of [[2014 Segunda División B play-offs|the play-offs]].
===Córdoba=== On 3 July 2014, Andone signed a three-year deal with [[Córdoba CF|Córdoba]], being initially assigned to [[Córdoba CF B|the reserves]] in the same division.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/2014/07/03/futbol/equipos/cordoba/1404402468.html |title=El Córdoba ficha al delantero rumano Florin Andone|trans-title=Córdoba signs Romanian forward Florin Andone |publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]] |language=es |date=3 July 2014 |accessdate=4 December 2014}}</ref> On 29 November, he was promoted to the main squad by manager [[Miroslav Đukić]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20141129/futbol/el-cordoba-buscara-su-primer-triunfo-ante-un-villarreal-fatigado-por-europa_54420877534.html |title=El Córdoba buscará su primer triunfo ante un Villarreal fatigado por Europa|trans-title=Córdoba will seek for its first triumph against a Villarreal fatigued by ''Europa'' |publisher=[[El Mundo Deportivo (newspaper)|El Mundo Deportivo]] |language=es |date=29 November 2014 |accessdate=23 March 2015}}</ref>
Andone played his first match as a professional on 3 December 2014, replacing [[Xisco (footballer, born 1986)|Xisco]] in the 57th minute of a 0–1 away loss against [[Granada CF|Granada]], for [[2014–15 Copa del Rey|the season]]'s [[Copa del Rey]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/copa/dieciseisavos/ida/gda_cor/ |title=Sólo un trago en Granada|trans-title=Only one sip in Granada |publisher=Marca |language=es |date=3 December 2014 |accessdate=4 December 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal on the second leg, netting his side's only in a 1–1 home draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/copa/dieciseisavos/vuelta/cor_gda/ |title=Sólo el Granada lo ve claro|trans-title=Only Granada sees it clear |publisher=Marca |language=es |date=17 December 2014 |accessdate=17 December 2014}}</ref>
In his [[La Liga]] debut on 5 January 2015 Andone was handed his first start, and scored to confirm a 2–0 home win against the same opponent.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/spanish-primera-division/match/402464/cordoba-granada/report |title=Nabil Ghilas and Florin Andone carry Cordoba over Granada |publisher=[[ESPN FC]] |date=5 January 2015 |accessdate=5 January 2015}}</ref> On 16 January, in a 1–1 home draw against [[SD Eibar|Eibar]], he scored the first after only ten seconds,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espnfc.com/spanish-primera-division/match/402443/cordoba-eibar/report |title=Florin Andone scores inside 10 seconds as Cordoba settle for draw |publisher=ESPN FC |date=16 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref> being the [[Andalusia]]ns' fastest goal in the top level, and the fourth overall.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.es/deportes/futbol/20150116/abci-cordoba-rapido-201501162115.html |title=Florin Andone firma el cuarto gol más rápido en la historia de la Liga|trans-title=Florin Andone scores the fourth fastest goal in La Liga's history |publisher=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]] |language=es |date=17 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref>
Following Córdoba's relegation, he was named the [[Segunda División Player of the Month]] for October 2015 with four goals, which put his team in the top position.<ref name=best>{{cite news |title=Florin Andone named Liga Adelante Player of the Month for October |url=http://www.laliga.es/en/news/florin-andone-named-liga-adelante-player-of-the-month-for-october |accessdate=15 March 2016 |publisher=Liga de Futbol Profesional |date=5 November 2015}}</ref>
In January 2016, as [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]],<ref name=Andone>{{cite web |url=http://www.click.ro/sport/florin-andone-dorit-primera-division |title=Florin Andone, dorit în Primera Division |publisher=Click |date=2 January 2016 |language=Romanian}}</ref> [[Málaga CF|Málaga]],<ref name=Andone /> [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.prosport.ro/fotbal-extern/campionate-externe/florin-andone-dorit-de-doua-cluburi-din-anglia-englezii-si-au-trimis-reprezentanti-la-ultimul-meci-al-romanului-14955398 |title=Florin Andone, dorit de două cluburi din Anglia! Englezii şi-au trimis reprezentanţi la ultimul meci al românului |publisher=[[Prosport]] |date=5 January 2016 |language=Romanian}}</ref> [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.replicaonline.ro/florin-andone-dorit-de-una-din-marile-echipe-ale-angliei-218954/ |title=Florin Andone, dorit de una din marile echipe ale Angliei |publisher=replicaonline.ro |date=21 April 2015 |language=Romanian}}</ref> and [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digisport.ro/Sport/FOTBAL/Competitii/Liga+1/VIDEO+Steaua+l-a+vrut+si+pe+Florin+Andone+S-au+cerut+bani+multi+ |title=VIDEO Florin Andone a fost dorit de Steaua! De ce nu s-a realizat transferul |publisher=digisport.ro |date=8 January 2016 |language=Romanian}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digisport.ro/Sport/FOTBAL/Competitii/Liga+1/VIDEO+Florin+Andone+nu+ar+spune+nu+unui+imprumut+in+Liga+1+ |title=VIDEO Florin Andone nu ar spune 'nu' unui împrumut în Liga 1! "Cu siguranță nu valorez 6 milioane de euro" |publisher=digisport.ro |date=1 June 2015 |language=Romanian}}</ref> showed interest in Andone, he renewed his contract with the ''Blanquiverdes'' until 2018, receiving a wage per year 10 times higher (and 20 if his club earn promotion), and with a release clause of [[euro|€]]20 million, the highest such figure in the club's history.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.ro/stranieri/fabulos-andone-clauza-uriasa-la-cordoba-poate-deveni-al-doilea-cel-mai-scump-jucator-roman-din-istorie.html |title=FABULOS! Andone, clauza uriasa la Cordoba! Poate deveni al doilea cel mai scump jucator roman din istorie, dupa Mutu |publisher=[[Sport.ro]] |date=12 January 2016 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
On 3 April, he struck his first [[hat-trick]] in a 4–4 draw at [[Gimnàstic de Tarragona]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Lluvia de goles en el Nou Estadi|trans-title=Raining goals in the Nou Estadi |url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/segunda-division/2016/04/03/57012599e2704e830c8b457d.html |accessdate=23 April 2016 |publisher=Marca |date=3 April 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref> He ended his season with 21 goals after scoring the game's only at [[RCD Mallorca|Mallorca]] to achieve a [[2016 Segunda División play-offs|play-off]] place on 29 May, missing the final round in order to join up with Romania;<ref>{{cite news |title=Florin se marcha a la Eurocopa como pichichi|trans-title=Florin goes to the Euro as ''Pichichi'' |url=http://sevilla.abc.es/andalucia/cordoba/sevi-florin-marcha-eurocopa-como-pichichi-201605300027_noticia.html |accessdate=5 June 2016 |publisher=ABC |date=30 May 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref> he was ultimately beaten to the division's [[Pichichi Trophy]] by [[Elche CF|Elche]]'s [[Sergio León]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Sergio León gana el pichichi de Segunda y está loco por jugar con el Betis en Primera|trans-title=Sergio León wins the Segunda's ''Pichichi'' and is mad about playing for Betis in the Primera |url=http://elcorreoweb.es/deportes-betis/sergio-leon-gana-el-pichichi-de-segunda-y-esta-loco-por-jugar-con-el-betis-en-primera-LI1857951 |accessdate=5 June 2016 |publisher=El Decano |date=4 June 2016 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
===Deportivo La Coruña=== On 22 July 2016, top-flight club [[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo La Coruña]] transferred Andone for [[Euro|€]]4.7 million plus 30% from a potential future transfer fee; it was the team's biggest purchase in the last nine years.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sport.ro/stranieri/oficial-florin-andone-la-super-depor-atacantul-roman-cel-mai-scump-transfer-din-ultimii-9-ani-pentru-fosta.html |title=OFICIAL. Florin Andone la Super Depor! Atacantul roman, cel mai scump transfer din ultimii 9 ani pentru fosta campioana a Spaniei|trans-title=OFFICIAL. Florin Andone to Super Depor! The Romanian attacker becomes the most expensive transfer of the last 9 years for the former champions of Spain |publisher=Sport.ro |language=ro |date=22 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/futbol/cordoba/2016/07/23/57938fa8468aeb92688b4680.html |title=El Córdoba pierde a Florin, Xisco y Fidel, el 70% de sus goles la pasada Liga|trans-title=Córdoba lose Florin, Xisco and Fidel, 70% of their league goals from last season |publisher=Marca |language=es |date=23 July 2016}}</ref> He was given the [[Squad number (association football)|number 10 jersey]] and made his debut as a substitute on 19 August in a 2–1 home win against [[SD Eibar|Eibar]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digisport.ro/Sport/FOTBAL/Competitii/La+Liga/Incepe+un+nou+sezon+in+La+Liga+Florin+Andone+debuteaza+pentru+De |title=Florin Andone a debutat oficial la Deportivo, în victoria cu 2–1 contra lui Eibar|trans-title=Florin Andone made his debut at Deportivo in the 2–1 victory against Eibar |publisher=[[DigiSport]] |language=ro |date=19 August 2016 |accessdate=23 August 2016}}</ref> scoring his first goal on 5 November to open a 1–1 draw at [[Granada CF|Granada]].<ref>{{cite news |title=FOTBAL EUROPEAN. Florin Andone a marcat primul gol pentru Deportivo La Coruna, în campionatul Spaniei. Atletico Madrid a fost învinsă la Sociedad|trans-title=EUROPEAN FOOTBALL. Florin Andone scored his first goal for Deportivo La Coruña, in the Spanish championship. Atlético Madrid was defeated by Sociedad |url=http://www.evz.ro/florin-andone-a-inscris-pentru-deportivo-la-coruna.html |accessdate=5 November 2016 |publisher=EVZ |date=5 November 2016 |language=Romanian}}</ref> He was named [[La Liga Player of the Month]] for December after contributing with 3 goals and 2 assists, including a brace in a win over [[Real Sociedad]].<ref name=Laliga/>
Andone scored his eighth goal of the season in a 1–1 league draw with [[Atlético Madrid]], on 2 March 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2016_17/la-liga/jornada_25/dep_atm/ |title=Griezmann maquilla los problemas del Atlético|trans-title=Griezmann makes up for Atlético's problems |publisher=Marca |language=Spanish |date=2 March 2017 |accessdate=4 March 2017}}</ref> On 26 April, he netted one for himself and also set up another goal in a 2–6 home loss to [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digisport.ro/Sport/FOTBAL/Competitii/La+Liga/VIDEO-Florin-Andone-la-primul-gol-in-poarta-lui-Real-Madrid |title=Florin Andone, la primul gol în poarta lui Real Madrid! Atacantul român a reușit și un assist!|trans-title=Florin Andone, at the first goal against Real Madrid! The Romanian attacker also managed to offer an assist! |publisher=Digi Sport |language=Romanian |date=26 April 2017 |accessdate=27 April 2017}}</ref>
In August 2017, Deportivo La Coruña turned down a €13 million offer for the player from [[Premier League]] side [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], with club president Tino Fernández stating that Andone would only leave if his €30 million [[Buyout clause|release clause]] is activated.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11708/10989679/burnley-make-11-8m-bid-for-deportivos-florin-andone |title=Burnley make £11.8m bid for Deportivo's Florin Andone |publisher=[[Sky Sports]] |date=15 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.laliganews.co.uk/3436/burnley-make-bid-florin-andone/ |title=Burnley make bid for Florin Andone |publisher=laliganews.co.uk |accessdate=20 August 2017}}</ref><ref name=AS>{{cite web |url=https://en.as.com/en/2017/08/30/football/1504097357_603259.html |title=Depor turn down €16m offer from Brighton for Andone |publisher=AS |date=30 August 2017}}</ref> [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] was also interested in transferring him,<ref name="AS"/> and made a €20 million bid which was also supposedly rejected.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.prosport.ro/fotbal-extern/stranieri/florin-andone-a-trecut-pe-langa-cel-mai-important-transfer-al-carierei-chiar-in-ultimele-ore-ale-perioadei-de-mercato-motivul-pentru-care-nu-a-mai-ajuns-in-premier-league-16713887 |title=Florin Andone a trecut pe lângă cel mai important transfer al carierei chiar în ultimele ore ale perioadei de mercato. Motivul pentru care nu a mai ajuns în Premier League |publisher=[[Prosport]] |date=1 September 2017 |language=Romanian}}</ref> He scored six goals and assisted three more in the [[2017–18 La Liga|2017–18 season]], which ended in relegation for the [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] team.<ref name=equipe/>
===Brighton & Hove Albion=== On 25 May 2018, Andone signed a five-year deal with [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] for an undisclosed transfer fee, and joined the [[Premier League]] side when the international transfer window opened on 8 June.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hilsum |first1=Jamie |title=Andone deal done |url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/may/albion-sign-andone/ |accessdate=25 May 2018 |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=25 May 2018}}</ref> The fee was rumoured as being €6 million, representing the release clause in his contract in case of Deportivo La Coruña's relegation.<ref name=equipe>{{cite news |title=Le Roumain Florin Andone du Deportivo à Brighton|trans-title=Romanian Florin Andone goes from Deportivo to Brighton |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Le-roumain-florin-andone-du-deportivo-a-brighton/904527 |accessdate=25 May 2018 |work=L'Équipe |date=25 May 2018 |language=French}}</ref>
Andone scored for Brighton in his first start (4th appearance) away against [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] to flip the game from 1–0 down to 2–1 up,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46326039 |title=Huddersfield 1–2 Brighton: Referee got big decisions wrong, says David Wagner |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=1 December 2018}}</ref> and netted again in the next game at the [[Falmer Stadium]] against rivals [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]], collecting the ball just inside the Palace half, dribbling into the area and scoring from an acute angle.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46353455 |title=Brighton 3-1 Crystal Palace: Ten-man Seagulls sweep Eagles aside |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=4 December 2018}}</ref>
On 5 January 2019, Andone scored on his [[FA Cup]] debut in a 3–1 away win against [[AFC Bournemouth|Bournemouth]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/av/football/46730661|title=FA Cup: AFC Bournemouth 1–3 Brighton & Hove Albion highlights|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 5 January 2019|accessdate= 5 January 2019}}</ref> and a month later he scored in a fourth round replay win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/av/football/47151469|title=FA Cup: West Bromwich Albion 1-3 Brighton & Hove Albion highlights|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 6 February 2019|accessdate= 6 February 2019}}</ref> Before his goal, he elbowed opponent [[Sam Field (footballer)|Sam Field]]'s face without the officials seeing; he was later fined and banned for three matches.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47162908|title=Brighton's Florin Andone banned for three games for elbow against West Brom |publisher=BBC Sport|date= 9 February 2019|accessdate= 9 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Andone stated that his dream is to play for the [[Romania national football team|Romania national team]], despite living in Spain for most of his life.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gsp.ro/international/stranieri/povestea-emotionanta-a-romanului-care-face-senzatie-in-la-liga-florin-andone-familia-mea-e-foarte-umila-si-muncitoare-asta-ma-mobilizeaza-442249.html |title=Povestea emoţionantă a românului care face senzaţie în La Liga » Florin Andone: "Familia mea e foarte umilă şi muncitoare, asta mă mobilizează!"|trans-title=The moving story of Romanian who is a sensation in La Liga » Florin Andone: "My family is very humble and hard working, this mobilizes me!" |publisher=[[Gazeta Sporturilor]] |language=Romanian |date=18 January 2015 |accessdate=26 January 2015}}</ref> He was called up by manager [[Anghel Iordănescu]] for the [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualifying|UEFA Euro 2016 qualification]] match against the [[Faroe Islands national football team|Faroe Islands]] in March 2015,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sevilla.abc.es/andalucia/cordoba/20150320/sevi-florin-convocado-rumania-201503201818.html |title=Rumanía convoca a Florin Andone|trans-title=Romania calls up Florin Andone |publisher=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]] |language=es |date=21 March 2015 |accessdate=22 March 2015}}</ref> but was an unused substitute in the 1–0 win. Andone made his full international debut in another qualifier on 13 June 2015, playing the last 18 minutes in a 0–0 away draw against [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/qualifiers/season=2016/matches/round=2000446/match=2013957/index.html |title=Romania hold Northern Ireland to stay top |publisher=UEFA.com |date=13 June 2015 |accessdate=14 June 2015}}</ref>
On 17 November 2015, Andone scored his first international goal, exploiting an error by [[Italy national football team|Italian]] goalkeeper [[Salvatore Sirigu]] for a last-minute equaliser in a 2–2 draw in [[Bologna]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Italy 2 Romania 2: Sirigu slips up as Italy draw |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/italy-2-romania-2-sirigu-slips-italy-draw |accessdate=12 June 2018 |work=FourFourTwo |date=17 November 2015}}</ref> He was selected for [[UEFA Euro 2016]] in France, where he started against [[France national football team|the hosts]] in the opening game after recovering from a hand injury,<ref>{{cite news |title=Deschamps demands that hosts make a positive start and set tone for a thrilling tournament |url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/euro2016/deschamps-demands-that-hosts-make-a-positive-start-and-set-tone-for-a-thrilling-tournament-34788094.html |accessdate=10 June 2016 |publisher=[[The Belfast Telegraph]] |date=10 June 2016}}</ref> and made two more substitute appearances in a [[UEFA Euro 2016 Group A|group-stage exit]].
==Style of play== Naturally right-footed, Andone plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] and has been praised for his work ethic.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.profit.ro/profitul-tau/sport/don-florin-andone-15488755 |title=Don Florin Andone |publisher=Profit.ro |language=Romanian |date=28 May 2016 |accessdate=7 September 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.digisport.ro/Sport/FOTBAL/Competitii/La+Liga/Andone-a-fost-caracterizat-de-catre-colegii-de-la-Depor-Ce-spune |title=Andone a fost caracterizat de către colegii de la Depor|trans-title=Andone was described by his Depor teammates |publisher=Digi Sport |language=Romanian |date=7 September 2017 |accessdate=7 September 2017}}</ref>
