Mouscron|Mouscron]] | youthyears5 = 2007–2009 | youthclubs5 = [[US Lesquin|Lesquin]] | years1 = 2009–2012 | clubs1 = [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]] | caps1 = 59 | goals1 = 13 | years2 = 2012–2015 | clubs2 = [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] | caps2 = 93 | goals2 = 13 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = [[Standard Liège]] | caps3 = 20 | goals3 = 5 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] | caps4 = 121 | goals4 = 25 <!-- This is for LEAGUE GOALS ONLY. Do NOT include other goals. -->| nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalgoals1 = 4 | nationalyears2 = 2012 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 3 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | club-update = 14:30, 9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }}
'''Anthony Patrick Knockaert''' (born 20 November 1991) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]].
==Club career==
===Guingamp=== Anthony Patrick Knockaert, who was born in [[Roubaix]], began his professional career with [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]], having previously spent his youth career at [[ES Wasquehal|Wasquehal]], Leers, [[RC Lens|Lens]], [[R.E. Mouscron|Mouscron]] and [[US Lesquin|Lesquin]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Entretien avec... Anthony Knockaert : " Un intérêt de Newcastle, c’est sûr que c’est flatteur "|url=http://www.footmercato.net/ligue2/entretien-avec-anthony-knockaert-un-interet-de-newcastle-c-est-sur-que-c-est-flatteur_79192|publisher=Foot Mercato|language=French|date=22 January 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> While progressing in the youth at Lesquin, he almost joined [[Leeds United A.F.C.|Leeds United]] in September 2008, but both parties could not agree terms after [[RC Lens|Lens]] intervened in the transfer and the fee would involved in compensation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lavoixdunord.fr/Locales/Roubaix/actualite/Sport_Metropole_Lilloise/2008/09/06/article_anthony-knockaert-ce-jeune-leersois-aura.shtml |title=Anthony Knockaert : ce jeune Leersois aurait signé en Angleterre si Leeds avait délié sa bourse |publisher=La Voix Du Nord Official Website |language=French |date=6 September 2008 |accessdate=6 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080909054433/http://www.lavoixdunord.fr/Locales/Roubaix/actualite/Sport_Metropole_Lilloise/2008/09/06/article_anthony-knockaert-ce-jeune-leersois-aura.shtml |archivedate=9 September 2008 |deadurl=yes }}</ref> At some point on progressing his youth career, Knockaert thought about considering quitting football after being told by the Lens' management that he was released because he was small at the time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Entretien avec Anthony Knockaert : " Leicester, un tremplin pour rejoindre un club plus huppé "|url=http://www.footmercato.net/premier-league/entretien-avec-anthony-knockaert-leicester-un-tremplin-pour-rejoindre-un-club-plus-huppe_137498|publisher=Foot Mercato|language=French|date=31 August 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
It was not until the summer of 2009 when he moved to Guingamp, where he signed his first professional contract.<ref>{{cite news|title=Anthony Knockaert signe à Guingamp|url=https://www.espoirsdufootball.com/anthony-knockaert-signe-a-guingamp-1755|publisher=ESPOIRSDUFOOTBALL.COM|language=French|date=7 April 2009|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> It was not until on 30 July 2010 when he made his Guingamp debut in the first round of the Coupe de la Ligue, scoring in a 2–1 win over [[Grenoble Foot 38|Grenoble]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Grenoble et Le Mans à la trappe|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Grenoble-et-le-mans-a-la-trappe/127132|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=30 July 2010|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> After playing 120 minutes, in a 3–2 win over [[Evian Thonon Gaillard F.C.|Evian]] in the second round of the Coupe de la Ligue,<ref>{{cite news|title=Guingamp sort Evian TG|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Guingamp-sort-evian-tg/133811|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=24 August 2010|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> he scored his second goal in the Coupe de la Ligue, in a 3–2 win over on 22 September 2010.<ref>{{cite news|title=Guingamp remet ça|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Guingamp-remet-ca/142260|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=22 September 2010|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Seven days later, on 29 September 2010, he made his league debut, making his first start and played 69 minutes before being substituted, in a 5–0 win over [[Gap FC|Gap]].<ref>{{cite news|title=GUINGAMP VS. GAP 5 – 0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/09/29/france/national/en-avant-de-guingamp/gap-football-club/988182/|publisher=Soccerway|date=29 September 2010|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Soon after, he signed a three-year contract with the club on 6 October 2010<ref>{{cite news|title=Guingamp : Knockaert signe pro|url=http://www.foot-national.com/foot-guingamp-knockaert-signe-pro-19936.html|publisher=Foot National|language=French|date=6 October 2010|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Knockaert then scored his first league goals, in a 6–0 win over [[UJA Maccabi Paris Métropole|Maccabi Paris Métropole]] on 22 April 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=MACCABI PARIS UJA VS. GUINGAMP 0 – 6|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/04/22/france/national/uja-alfortville/en-avant-de-guingamp/988443/|publisher=Soccerway|date=22 April 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> After helping the club's promotion to Ligue 2, he made 27 appearances scoring 4 times in all competitions.
In the 2011–12 season, Knockaert started the season well when he scored twice in a 2–0 win over [[Vannes OC|Vannes]] in the second round of the Coupe de la Ligue on 9 August 2011.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lens s'en sort très bien|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Lens-s-en-sort-tres-bien/219495|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=9 August 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Weeks later, on 9 September 2011, he scored his first goal of the season, in a 2–1 loss against [[Stade de Reims|Reims]].<ref>{{cite news|title=L2 (J6) : Les résultats|url=http://www.football365.fr/l2-j6-les-resultats-8-1813321.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=9 September 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> It was not until on 17 October 2011 when he scored again, in a 4–1 win over [[AS Monaco FC|AS Monaco]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Monaco, le cauchemar|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Monaco-le-cauchemar/236806|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=17 October 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> In the ten matches between on 19 December 2011 and 16 March 2012, he scored six times against [[CS Sedan Ardennes|Sedan]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Fauvergue sans pitié avec Guingamp|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Fauvergue-sans-pitie-avec-guingamp/251012|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=19 December 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> [[FC Istres|Istres]],<ref>{{cite news|title=REJOINT IN EXTREMIS PAR LENS, MONACO RATE LE COCHE|url=http://www.football365.fr/rejoint-in-extremis-par-lens-monaco-rate-le-coche-1255713.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=30 January 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> [[US Boulogne|Boulogne]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Nantes marque le pas|url=http://www.football365.fr/nantes-marque-le-pas-1259567.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=17 February 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> [[Le Havre AC|Le Havre]],<ref>{{cite news|title=(J25) : Les résultats|url=http://www.football365.fr/j25-les-resultats-2-1847699.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=24 February 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> [[Troyes AC|Troyes]]<ref>{{cite news|title=(Matchs en retard) : Les résultats|url=http://www.football365.fr/matchs-en-retard-les-resultats-1850013.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=6 March 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and Lens.<ref>{{cite news|title=(J28) : Les scores à la pause|url=http://www.football365.fr/j28-les-scores-a-la-pause-1852101.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=16 March 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Knockaert then scored three more goals later in the season, scoring twice against [[FC Metz|Metz]]<ref>{{cite news|title=(J36) : Les résultats|url=http://www.football365.fr/j36-les-resultats-4-1863093.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=4 May 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and once against [[Clermont Foot|Clermont]].<ref>{{cite news|title=REIMS ET TROYES EN L1, METZ QUASIMENT CONDAMNÉ|url=http://www.football365.fr/reims-et-troyes-en-l1-metz-quasiment-condamne-1271461.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=11 May 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> He finished the 2011–12 season making 38 appearances and scoring thirteen times in all competitions.
At the end of the season, Knockaert's performance at Guingamp attracted interests from clubs around Europe, such as English side [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Newcastle sur Knockaert|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Newcastle-sur-knockaert/249390|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=12 December 2011|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and Portuguese side [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Benfica Lisbonne : Knockaert sur les tablettes|url=http://www.football365.fr/benfica-lisbonne-knockaert-sur-les-tablettes-1856603.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=6 April 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>, as well as being linked with his native country side [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Montpellier suit aussi Mendes|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Montpellier-suit-aussi-mendes/277502|publisher=L'Equipe|language=French|date=16 April 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
===Leicester City=== [[File:Anthony Knockaert.jpg|thumb|Knockaert warming up for [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in 2013]] On 1 August 2012, Knockaert moved to [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] on a three-year contract.<ref name="Terms agreed for Knockeart">{{cite web|title=Terms Agreed for Knockaert |url=http://origin-www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~2868593,00.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20121129070659/http://origin-www.lcfc.com/page/LatestNews/0,,10274~2868593,00.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=29 November 2012 |publisher=Leicester City F.C |date=1 August 2012 |accessdate=5 October 2012 }}</ref> The transfer fee was undisclosed before the transfer fee was revealed as £2.5 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=10 facts on new Leicester City star Anthony Knockaert|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/10-facts-new-leicester-city-star-anthony/story-17027669-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=4 October 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161206221400/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/10-facts-new-leicester-city-star-anthony/story-17027669-detail/story.html|archivedate=6 December 2016}}</ref>
Knockaert made his Leicester City debut on 18 August 2012, where he came on as a substitute for [[Lloyd Dyer]] in the second half, in a 2–0 win over [[Peterborough United F.C.|Peterborough United]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 2 – 0 Peterborough United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/19221558|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 August 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> he then scored his first goal for Leicester with a free-kick against [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] in the League Cup on 28 August 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19340403|title=Leicester 2 – 4 Burton Albion|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=28 August 2012 |accessdate=28 August 2012}}</ref> His first league goals came in a 2–0 win at [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 2 October 2012. The first was a 35-yard shot into the top corner, while the second saw him flick the ball in from behind with his left heel, after a cross from left-back [[Paul Konchesky]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19725435|title=Huddersfield Town 0 – 2 Leicester|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=2 October 2012 |accessdate=2 October 2012}}</ref> By the end 2012, he scored two more goals against [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 6 – 0 Ipswich Town|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20278292|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 November 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 2 – 2 Barnsley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20564609|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 December 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> On 1 January 2013, he scored another two league goals for the club in the reverse fixture against Huddersfield Town with Leicester City winning 6–1<ref>{{cite web|title=Leicester City 6 – 1 Huddersfield Town|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/20840951|publisher=[[BBC]]|date=1 January 2013|accessdate=1 January 2013}}</ref> and then scored another by the end of January, with a 2–1 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 2 – 1 Wolverhampton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21175818|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 January 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> On 4 May 2013, he scored the winning goal in a 3–2 victory over [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] at the [[City Ground]] that got Leicester City into a playoff place.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester grab play-off place on final day of season after a 3–2 win at Forest|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/n-forest-vs-leicester/262648|publisher=Sky Sports|date=4 May 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref><ref name="football-league">{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20130504/championship-round-up_2293322_3164758 |title=The Football League | Championship round-up |publisher=The Football League |accessdate=26 August 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130508062159/http://www.football-league.co.uk/championship/news/20130504/championship-round-up_2293322_3164758 |archivedate=8 May 2013 |deadurl=yes }}</ref> Following his performance against Forest, which also contained an assist for [[Andy King (footballer born 1988)|Andy King]]'s 50th Leicester goal, Knockaert was named in the Championship Team of the Week, alongside King.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.efl.com/news/article/championship-team-of-the-week-1873625.aspx |title=CHAMPIONSHIP TEAM OF THE WEEK |publisher=The Football League Official Website |date=6 May 2014 |accessdate=6 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161206222521/http://www.efl.com/news/article/championship-team-of-the-week-1873625.aspx |archivedate=6 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref> However, in the [[2012–13 Football League Championship|2013 Playoff semi-final second leg]], with the aggregate scores level he won a penalty for Leicester City deep into stoppage time. He opted to take the penalty himself but it was saved by [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] goalkeeper [[Manuel Almunia]] who also saved the follow-up.<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/championship-playoffs-anthony-knockaert-distraught-after-penalty-miss-for-leicester-8613610.html | title=Championship play-offs: Anthony Knockaert 'distraught' after penalty miss for Leicester | location=London | work=The Independent | first=Andy | last=Sims | date=13 May 2013}}</ref> With the ball still in play, and with Knockaert standing still and making no effort to win back the ball, Watford broke quickly and scored just seconds later to go through. Despite this, he went on to win both Young Player of the Year and Goal of the Season against Huddersfield Town<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/290413-morgan-named-double-player-of-the-year-799249.aspx |title=Morgan Named Double Player of the Year |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=29 April 2014 |accessdate=7 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207214327/http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/290413-morgan-named-double-player-of-the-year-799249.aspx |archivedate=7 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref> and finished his first season making 47 appearances and scoring nine times in all competitions.
In the 2013–14 season, Knockaert scored his first goal of the 2013–14 season in the 5–2 [[2013–14 Football League Cup|League Cup]] victory away to [[Carlisle United F.C.|Carlisle United]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Capital One Cup: Leicester City beat Carlisle United 5–2 at Brunton Park|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/carlisle-vs-leicester/300441|publisher=Sky Sports|date=28 August 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and scored again in the second round of the League Cup with a 30-yard free kick at home to [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] and then assisted [[Danny Drinkwater]]'s winning goal in a 2nd half come back in the 3rd round victory.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 2 – 1 Derby County|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24122155|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> Despite his good performances, he did not score his first league goal until Leicester's 3–0 away win against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Championship: Anthony Knockaert enjoys better afternoon in Leicester's 3–0 win at Watford|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/watford-vs-leicester/287832|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 November 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> After scoring three more goals from December to early-January against Sheffield Wednesday,<ref>{{cite news|title=Sheffield Wednesday 2 – 1 Leicester City|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25098500|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 December 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> [[Bolton Wanderers F.C.|Bolton Wanderers]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City 5 – 3 Bolton Wanderers|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25482225|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 December 2013|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Sky Bet Championship: Leicester City ease past Millwall 3–1|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/millwall-vs-leicester/287949|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 January 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> He was a regular member of a settled side that went unbeaten from early December until 5 April, when promotion was assured after losses by third placed [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|QPR]] and fourth placed Derby County. Knockaert had scored the winning goal from a free-kick in a Friday night fixture the day before, at home to [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]].<ref>{{cite web|last=BBC|title=Leicester City win promotion to Premier League after 10 year absence.|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26906091|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 April 2014}}</ref> He went on to finish the 2014–15 season making 50 appearances and scoring 7 times in all competitions.
In the 2014–15 season, Knockaert made his first Premier League appearance in the opening game of the season, where he played 64 minutes before being substituted, in a 2–2 draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Premier League: Leicester draw 2–2 with Everton at the King Power Stadium|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/leicester-vs-everton/313389|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 August 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> However, he struggled to regain his first team place, owing to the performances of [[Nick Powell]], [[Marc Albrighton]] and [[Danny Simpson]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City news: Winger Anthony Knockaert is challenged to win back first-team place|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-winger-anthony-knockaert/story-24165039-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=5 November 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161206224849/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-winger-anthony-knockaert/story-24165039-detail/story.html|archive-date=6 December 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In effort to fight for the first team place, he was sent to play for the club's reserves, which he did for the most of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City news: Anthony Knockaert eager to prove his worth ahead of Premier League clash|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-news-anthony-knockaert-eager-prove/story-23677238-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=24 October 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161206225004/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-news-anthony-knockaert-eager-prove/story-23677238-detail/story.html|archive-date=6 December 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Despite being rumoured to be loaned out to clubs in the Championship throughout the season, manager Pearson blocked his loan move from happening unless the squad was strengthened.<ref>{{cite news|title=Nigel Pearson unlikely to loan Leicester City players despite Anthony Knockaert being linked with Leeds and Wolves|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/nigel-pearson-unlikely-loan-leicester-city/story-24646817-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=24 November 2014|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161206225115/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/nigel-pearson-unlikely-loan-leicester-city/story-24646817-detail/story.html|archive-date=6 December 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Nevertheless, Knockaert made 11 appearances in the 2014–15 season in all competitions.
At the end of the 2014–15 season, Knockaert's contract was set to expire and he began talks with the club over a new contract,<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City are in talks with 10 players who are out of contract this summer|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-talks-10-players-contract-summer/story-26162239-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=24 February 2015|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170404204710/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-talks-10-players-contract-summer/story-26162239-detail/story.html|archive-date=4 April 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> with manager Pearson revealing that he was given a "fair contract offer".<ref>{{cite news|title=Nigel Pearson hopeful Anthony Knockaert will stay at Leicester City after 'very fair' contract offer|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/nigel-pearson-hopeful-anthony-knockaert-stay/story-26274120-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=2 April 2015|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811024251/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Nigel-Pearson-hopeful-Anthony-Knockaert-stay/story-26274120-detail/story.html|archive-date=11 August 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> However, he rejected a contract, revealing he had been offered a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite news|title=Anthony Knockaert: 'I turned down a four-year deal at Leicester City'|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/anthony-knockaert-turned-year-deal-leicester-city/story-26760541-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=24 June 2015|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150901120939/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Anthony-Knockaert-turned-year-deal-Leicester-City/story-26760541-detail/story.html|archive-date=1 September 2015|dead-url=yes}}</ref> Despite this, Knockaert made a farewell message to Leicester City supporters upon leaving the club, stating that he would not forget the club.<ref>{{cite news|title=Anthony Knockaert's goodbye message to Leicester City fans|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/anthony-knockaert-s-goodbye-message-leicester/story-26619990-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=2 June 2015|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150723002937/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Anthony-Knockaert-s-goodbye-message-Leicester/story-26619990-detail/story.html|archive-date=23 July 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Standard Liège===
On 4 June 2015, it was announced that Knockaert had joined [[Standard Liège]] on a free transfer.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anthony KNOCKAERT chez les Rouches !|url=http://www.standard.be/toutes-les-news/lire/~anthony-knockaert-chez-les-rouches.htm?lng=fr|publisher=Standard Liege|accessdate=4 June 2015|date=4 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150609045105/http://www.standard.be/toutes-les-news/lire/~anthony-knockaert-chez-les-rouches.htm?lng=fr|archivedate=9 June 2015}}</ref> It came after the club had begun to open talks with Knockaert the month before.<ref>{{cite news|title=Knockaert linked with Standard Liège switch|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/leicester-city-transfer-news-anthony-knockaert-linked-with-standard-li-ge-switch-10229876.html|work=The Independent|date=7 May 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref>
Knockaert started well on his Standard Liège debut when he scored his first goal for the club despite losing 2–1 to [[K.V. Kortrijk|Kortrijk]] in the opening game of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ook Standard begint competitie met nederlaag (in Kortrijk)|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag1/1.2397125|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=25 July 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> Five days later, he scored again, but this time in an UEFA Europa League match against [[FK Željezničar Sarajevo|Željezničar Sarajevo]], as well as, setting up a goal in a 2–1 win.<ref>{{cite news|title=Vermijdbare tegengoal zet domper op verdiende zege Standard|url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20150730_01798508|publisher=Nieuwsblad|language=Dutch|date=30 July 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> Following this, he scored again in the league on 15 August 2015, in a 1–1 draw against [[Royal Excel Mouscron|Mouscron]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Standard raakt niet voorbij Moeskroen na teleurstellende match|url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20150815_01819461|publisher=Nieuwsblad|language=Dutch|date=15 August 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> and scoring two weeks later, in a UEFA Europa League against [[Molde FK|Molde]] in the return leg, in a 3–1 win, but was eliminated following an away goal from Molde.<ref>{{cite news|title=Standard mag poules Europa League op zijn buik schrijven|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39651/MG_playoffronde_terug/1.2422520|publisher=Sporza|language=Dutch|date=27 August 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> Despite this, he scored three more goals by the end of 2015 against [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]],<ref>{{cite news|title=AA Gent duwt negen Luikenaars nog dieper in de put|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag8/1.2443759|publisher=Sporz.be|language=Dutch|date=20 September 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> [[K.R.C. Genk|Genk]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Genk duwt Standard nog een beetje dieper in de put|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag10/1.2457362|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=4 October 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> and [[KV Mechelen|Mechelen]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Standard wipt de middenmoot in na zege tegen KV Mechelen|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag13/1.2480193|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=28 October 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> However, in a match against [[Oud-Heverlee Leuven]] on 26 September 2015, Knockaert reacted furiously via Twitter when he substituted during the second half, in a 2–2 draw.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ferrera strijkt plooien glad na clash met Knockaert|url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20150928_01890609|publisher=Nieuwsblad|language=Dutch|date=28 September 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> Following, he soon apologised the way he behaved and vowed to be calmer next time.<ref>{{cite news|title=Knockaert: "Ik excuseer me bij fans en moet leren kalmer te zijn"|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/voetbal/Jupiler_Pro_League/1.2459062|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=3 October 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref>
Between July 2015 and January 2016, Knockaert made 20 appearances and scored 5 goals in [[2015–16 Standard Liège season|2015–16]] for the club despite missing out a game, due to suspension after picking a yellow card for the fifth time this season against Anderlecht on 8 November 2015.<ref>{{cite news|title=Standard en Kortrijk delen de punten ondanks spannend slot|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag16/1.2498857|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=22 November 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Standard houdt Anderlecht onder de duim|url=http://sporza.be/cm/sporza/matchcenter/mc_voetbal/2.39309/JPL_Speeldag15/1.2488966|publisher=Sporza.be|language=Dutch|date=8 November 2015|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> On 6 January 2016, Standard confirmed they had accepted an offer from Championship side [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] with the player set to travel to England to agree personal terms.<ref>{{cite web|title=Anthony Knockaert|url=http://www.standard.be/toutes-les-news/lire/~anthony-knockaert.htm?lng=fr|publisher=Standard Liege|accessdate=7 January 2016|date=6 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160110060304/http://www.standard.be/toutes-les-news/lire/~anthony-knockaert.htm?lng=fr|archive-date=10 January 2016|dead-url=yes}}</ref>
===Brighton & Hove Albion===
====2015–16 season==== On 7 January 2016, [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] confirmed the signing of Knockaert for an undisclosed fee on a three-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/anthony-knockaert-completes-brighton-hove-albion-move-2888911.aspx |title=Knockaert completes Albion move |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |accessdate=7 January 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160602125733/http://www.seagulls.co.uk//news/article/anthony-knockaert-completes-brighton-hove-albion-move-2888911.aspx |archivedate=2 June 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref> Upon joining the club, he said the move interested him, citing the club's ambition as the reason he returned to England.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/anthony-knockaert-attracted-by-albion-ambition-2889348.aspx |title=KNOCKAERT ATTRACTED BY ALBION'S AMBITION |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=8 January 2016 |accessdate=7 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207204934/http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/anthony-knockaert-attracted-by-albion-ambition-2889348.aspx |archivedate=7 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref>
Knockaert made his Brighton debut five days after signing with the club on 12 January 2016, playing the full 90 minutes in a 2–0 defeat against [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Gordon Greer returns and Anthony Knockaert makes debut|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/14199307.Greer_back_and_Knockaert_makes_debut/|publisher=The Argus|date=12 January 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> He soon began to have an impact at Brighton, setting up two assists for his team in a 2–1 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] on 23 January 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 2–1 Huddersfield Town|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35330585|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 January 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Brighton in a 3–0 win over [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 5 February 2016.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35435908|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–0 Brentford|date=5 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 February 2016}}</ref>
Knockaert was a key performer for Brighton in April 2016, scoring against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 2–2 Burnley: Michael Keane rescues point for Clarets in 2–2 thriller|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brighton-vs-burnley/339989|publisher=Sky Sports|date=2 April 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 5 – 0 Fulham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35994191|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 April 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> and twice against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], as the club pushed for automatic promotion.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 4–0 Queens Park Rangers: Anthony Knockaert nets twice in rout|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brighton-vs-qpr/340038|publisher=Sky Sports|date=19 April 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> His performances in April earned him the Player of the Month award.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/chris-hughton-and-anthony-knockaert-win-aprils-skybet-awards-3097470.aspx |title=HUGHTON AND KNOCKAERT WIN SKYBET AWARDS |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion |date=6 May 2016 |accessdate=7 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207210355/http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/chris-hughton-and-anthony-knockaert-win-aprils-skybet-awards-3097470.aspx |archivedate=7 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref> Despite Brighton's unsuccessful attempt to reach promotion to the Premier League after losing in the play-offs, Knockaert impressed for the club, making 16 appearances and scoring 5 times.
====2016–17 season==== In the 2016–17 season, Knockaert was linked with a move to recently relegated side Newcastle United, but Brighton rejected their bid.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton and Hove Albion knock back Newcastle bid for winger Anthony Knockaert|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/14649676.Albion_knock_back_Newcastle_bid_for_winger/|publisher=The Argus|date=29 July 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> He began the season well, scoring three goals for Brighton in their first five matches against Nottingham Forest,<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–0 Nottingham Forest: Glenn Murray double seals win|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brighton-vs-n-forest/358125|publisher=Sky Sports|date=12 August 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> Rotherham United<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–0 Rotherham United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37017831|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 August 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> and [[Reading F.C.|Reading]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Reading 2–2 Brighton & Hove Albion: Albion stay unbeaten|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/reading-vs-brighton/358155|publisher=Sky Sports|date=20 August 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> He also began playing in advanced role behind [[Tomer Hemed]] up front.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/anthony-knockaert-brighton-hove-albion-3306806.aspx |title=KNOCKAERT HAPPY WITH MORE ADVANCED ROLE |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=14 September 2016 |accessdate=7 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207210816/http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/anthony-knockaert-brighton-hove-albion-3306806.aspx |archivedate=7 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref> He scored again for Brighton on 13 September 2016, in a 1–0 win over Huddersfield Town.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Huddersfield Town: Brighton & Hove Albion squeeze past Huddersfield Town|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brighton-vs-huddsfld/358183|publisher=Sky Sports|date=13 September 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> In October 2016, Knockaert scored against [[Sheffield Wednesday F.C.|Sheffield Wednesday]],<ref>{{cite news|title=Sheffield Wednesday 1 – 2 Brighton & Hove Albion|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37458721|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 October 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> and also contributed to Brighton's 5–0 drubbing of [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 5–0 Norwich City: Glenn Murray hits hat-trick for Brighton & Hove Albion|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/brighton-vs-norwich/358281|publisher=Sky Sports|date=29 October 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref>
On 3 March 2017, Knockaert signed a new four-year contract extension with the club, expiring in June 2021.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/anthony-knockaert-brighton-hove-albion-3606697.aspx|title=Anthony Knockaert signs contract extension|last=Hilsum|first=James|access-date=4 March 2017|language=en}}</ref> On 9 April 2017, he was named EFL's Championship Player of the Year having scored 13 goals in 40 games at that stage of the season.<ref name="BBC Sport">{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39548007|title=Brighton's Anthony Knockaert is named Championship Player of the Year|date=9 April 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=14 April 2017|language=en-GB}}</ref> He finished the season with 15 goals in 45 appearances in the league and overall where Brighton were promoted to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion: From the brink of disaster to the Premier League – BBC Sport|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39625659|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 April 2017|accessdate=17 April 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== Brighton's first match in the top flight for 34 years was at home to eventual champions [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]. Knockaert was bought on to replace [[Solly March]] in the 75th minute with Brighton trailing 2–0, the scoreline that the game finished.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City- BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 August 2018}}</ref> Knockaert scored his first Premier League goal on 15 October 2017, in a 1–1 home draw against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41541146|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–1 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 October 2017}}</ref> He scored his second Premier League goal for Brighton on 1 January 2018, the opening goal in a 2–2 draw against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|AFC Bournemouth]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42411021|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 2–2 AFC Bournemouth|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 January 2018}}</ref> Knockaert played in the 1–0 home victory over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester Utd]] on 4 May 2018 which secured Albion's Premier League status. BBC Sport's Emlyn Begley described Knockaert and fellow winger [[José Heriberto Izquierdo Mena|Jose Izquierdo]] as "fantastic" in this game.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43916611|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Manchester United – BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 May 2018}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== On 5 January 2019 Knockaert scored his first ever [[FA Cup]] goal in a 3–1 away win against south coast rivals Bournemouth in the third round.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/av/football/46730661|title=FA Cup: AFC Bournemouth 1–3 Brighton & Hove Albion highlights – BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 5 January 2019|accessdate= 5 January 2019}}</ref> On 9 March 2019 Knockaert scored a screamer which turned out to be the winner against bitter rivals [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] where it finished 2–1 at [[Selhurst Park]]. This win meant Brighton won the double over Palace.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47424852|title=Crystal Palace V Brighton & Hove Albion – BBC Sport|publisher=BBC Sport|date= 9 March 2019|accessdate= 9 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== After representing [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]], Knockaert was called up by [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] for the first time<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/130812-france-call-up-for-knockaert-308780.aspx |title=France Call-Up For Knockaert |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=13 August 2012 |accessdate=6 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121017131304/http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/130812-france-call-up-for-knockaert-308780.aspx |archivedate=17 October 2012 |deadurl=no }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Espoirs : La liste pour la Slovaquie et le Chili|url=http://www.football365.fr/espoirs-la-liste-pour-la-slovaquie-et-le-chili-1888681.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=29 August 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and made his France U21 debut, scoring in a 2–1 win over [[Chile national under-20 football team|Chile U20]] on 10 September 2012.<ref>{{cite news|title=AMICAL : FRANCE ESPOIRS-CHILI ESPOIRS (4–0)|url=http://www.football365.fr/amical-france-espoirs-chili-espoirs-4-0-1891633.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=10 September 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> He went on to make two more France U21 appearance against [[Norway national under-21 football team|Norway U21]] on 12 October 2012<ref>{{cite news|title=Euro 2013 (barrages aller) : France-Norvège (1–0)|url=http://www.football365.fr/euro-2013-barrages-aller-france-norvege-1-0-1897793.html|publisher=Football 365|language=French|date=12 October 2012|accessdate=6 December 2016}}</ref> and 16 October 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/171012-internationals-king-and-knockaert-feature-429997.aspx |title=Internationals: King & Knockaert Feature |publisher=Leicester City F.C. |date=17 October 2012 |accessdate=6 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121019173456/http://www.lcfc.com/news/article/171012-internationals-king-and-knockaert-feature-429997.aspx |archivedate=19 October 2012 |deadurl=no }}</ref>
==Personal life== In 2015, Knockaert was given a personal leave by the club after his father, Patrick, became ill.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leicester City winger Anthony Knockaert to miss Tottenham match|url=http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/leicester-city-winger-anthony-knockaert-miss/story-26201404-detail/story.html|work=Leicester Mercury|date=19 March 2015|accessdate=6 December 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150810032505/http://www.leicestermercury.co.uk/Leicester-City-winger-Anthony-Knockaert-miss/story-26201404-detail/story.html|archive-date=10 August 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The following year, when his father died on 3 November 2016, he sat out of the match against [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Anthony Knockaert: Brighton players support French winger at father's funeral|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37914763|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 November 2016|accessdate=7 December 2016}}</ref> It was not the first time he suffered a tragedy: he lost his elder brother, Steve, in 2011 and after scoring in a 3–0 win against Nottingham Forest, Knockaert dedicated his goal to his late brother.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/anthony-knockaert-brighton-hove-albion-3244735.aspx |title=KNOCKAERT'S EMOTIONAL DEDICATION |publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C. |date=13 August 2016 |accessdate=7 December 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161207211721/http://www.seagulls.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/anthony-knockaert-brighton-hove-albion-3244735.aspx |archivedate=7 December 2016 |deadurl=no }}</ref>
In September 2018 he revealed his struggles with mental health issues.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45591883|title=Anthony Knockaert: Brighton & Hove Albion winger reveals mental health struggles|date=20 September 2018|accessdate=20 September 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>

'''Pascal Groß''' ({{IPA-de|pasˈkaːl ˈɡʁoːs}}, sometimes rendered in English as '''Gross'''; born 15 June 1991) is a German professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. Groß is a youth international for Germany.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://datencenter.dfb.de/profil/151555/spiele_in_wettbewerb/1355/31271#c1355_t31271|title=Pascal Groß Personenprofil :: DFB – Deutscher Fußball-Bund e.V.|website=datencenter.dfb.de}}</ref>
==Career== ===Early career=== Groß played his first fully professional match in the [[Bundesliga]] for [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] on 2 May 2009 in a 0–4 loss against [[VfL Wolfsburg]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/spielpaarungsbericht/object/863684|title=13-Minuten-Hattrick von Dzeko|work=kicker.de|date=2 May 2009|accessdate=3 May 2009}}</ref> being substituted on in the 89th minute for [[Chinedu Obasi]]. In January 2011, he transferred to [[Karlsruher SC]] along with Hoffenheim teammate [[Marco Terrazzino]].<ref name="KSC">{{cite web|title=KSC verpflichtet zwei U20-Nationalspieler: Terrazzino und Groß wechseln in den Wildpark|trans-title=KSC signs two U20 Internationals: Terrazzino and Groß are transferring to the Wildpark|language=German|date=28 January 2011|accessdate=28 January 2011|publisher=[[Karlsruher SC]]|work=official website|url=http://www.ksc.de/aktuelles/anzeigen/news/ksc-verpflichtet-zwei-u20-nationalspieler-terrazzino-und-gross-wechseln-in-den-wildpark.html|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110131080343/http://www.ksc.de/aktuelles/anzeigen/news/ksc-verpflichtet-zwei-u20-nationalspieler-terrazzino-und-gross-wechseln-in-den-wildpark.html|archivedate=31 January 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Ingolstadt=== Groß scored five league goals for [[FC Ingolstadt]] in the 2016–17 season as they were relegated from the Bundesliga. He created more chances than any other player in the league that season, a total of 95 chances.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/brighton-pascal-gross-first-premier-league-signing-chris-hughton-/1u4yjm9p946n6zf8nwo2aq68k|title=Brighton sign Pascal Groß|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=9 September 2017}}</ref>
{{Expand section|date=November 2017}}
===Brighton & Hove Albion=== In May 2017, [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] signed Groß for a fee of £3 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pascal Gross: Brighton & Hove Albion sign FC Ingolstadt 04 midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39980263|accessdate=19 May 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=19 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-england-brh-new-gross/brightons-under-the-radar-signing-gross-proving-his-worth-idUKKCN1BX2RV |title=Brighton's under the radar signing Gross proving his worth|first=Pete|last= Hall|date=22 September 2017|work=Reuters }}</ref> He agreed to a four-year contract while the transfer fee paid to Ingolstadt was the first of a series of record signings for the club that season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportbible.com/football/transfers-brighton-have-broken-their-transfer-record-yet-again-20170807 |title=Brighton Have Broken Their Transfer Record Yet Again|first=Josh |last=Lawless |work=Sport Bible |date=7 August 2017}}</ref>
He made his debut for Brighton in the [[Premier League]] on 12 August 2017, in a 2–0 home defeat to title favourites [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 August 2017}}</ref> On 9 September 2017, Groß made history by scoring Brighton's first ever Premier League goal, adding a second shortly after half time and providing an assist for [[Tomer Hemed]] in a 3–1 win at home against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Premier League ruft! Gross verlässt FCI|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/678459/artikel_premier-league-ruft-gross-verlaesst-fci.html|accessdate=19 May 2017|work=kicker Online|date=19 May 2017|language=German}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–1 West Bromwich Albion|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133349|accessdate=10 September 2017|work= BBC Sport|date=9 September 2017}}</ref> On 15 September, in Brighton's 2–1 league defeat away to [[AFC Bournemouth]], Groß provided the assist for [[Solly March]]'s opening goal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41196761|title=AFC Bournemouth 2–1 Brighton & Hove Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2017}}</ref>
Groß's creative exploits for Brighton throughout the month of September earned him a nomination for the [[Premier League]] Player of the Month award. He was a key player for Brighton, being directly involved in four of their league goals scored throughout the month.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15582380.Let_s_be_more_confident__award_contender_Gross_urges_Albion/|title=Premier League player of the month contender Pascal Gross urges Brighton and Hove Albion to be more confident|publisher=The Argus|date=7 October 2017}}</ref>
On 15 October 2017, Groß provided his third assist of the season for Brighton, setting up [[Anthony Knockaert]] in a 1–1 league draw at home to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41541146|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–1 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 October 2017}}</ref> On 20 November, Groß scored for Brighton in a 2–2 home draw against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]]. The goal brought his contribution tally up to three goals and five assists throughout the course of the season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41964596|title=Brighton 2–2 Stoke|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 November 2017}}</ref>
Groß ended a successful season for Brighton with seven goals and eight assists, including heading the winner against Manchester United on 4 May 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43916611|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Manchester United|date=2018-05-04|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-GB}}</ref> Amongst many highlights, Groß was voted Brighton's player of the season by an overwhelming majority.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/16171462.Bargain_buy_Gross_named_Albion_s_Player_of_the_Season/|title=Bargain buy Gross named Albion's Player of the Season|website=The Argus|language=en|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref>
On 6 June 2018, Groß signed a contract extension with Brighton, keeping him at the club until 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/june/new-deal-for-midfielder/|title=New deal for midfielder|publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|date=6 June 2018|accessdate=7 June 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== His father, [[Stephan Groß|Stephan]], was also a footballer who played for [[Karlsruher SC]].<ref name="KSC"/>

'''Alireza Jahanbakhsh Jirandeh''' ({{lang-fa|علیرضا جهانبخش جیرنده}},{{IPA-fa|æliːɾezɑː dʒæhɑːnˈbæxʃ}}, born 11 August 1993) is an Iranian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] and [[Midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] side [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] and the [[Iran national football team|Iranian national team]]. He represented Iran at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], [[2015 AFC Asian Cup]], [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] and the [[2019 AFC Asian Cup]]. Jahanbakhsh also represented Iran at the [[Iran national under-20 football team|U20]] and [[Iran national under-23 football team|U23]] levels.
In 2014 Jahanbakhsh was voted the second greatest young talent of the 2013–14 [[Eredivisie]] season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Grootste talent 2013-2014|url=https://www.voetbalhubb.nl/ranking/grootste-talent-eredivisie-2013-2014|website=www.voetbalhubb.nl|language=nl}}</ref> In the [[2017–18 Eredivisie]] season, Jahanbakhsh scored 21 league goals and became the first Asian player to become top scorer in a major European league.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ifpnews.com/exclusive/jahanbakhsh-becomes-first-asian-top-scorer-of-major-european-leagues/|title=Jahanbakhsh Becomes First Asian Top Scorer of Major European Leagues|date=6 May 2018}}</ref><ref name="foxsportsasia.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/asian-football/878070/irans-alireza-jahanbakhsh-finishes-eredivisie-top-scorer/|title=Iran's Alireza Jahanbakhsh finishes as Eredivisie top scorer|date=6 May 2018|publisher=FOX Sports Asia}}</ref>
==Early life== Alireza Jahanbakhsh was born on 11 August 1993 in [[Rasht]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FxL5tMyKen4 |title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh interview July 14, 2014 |via=YouTube |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.varzesh3.com/news/1562096|title=از داماش تا برایتون با علیرضا جهانبخش|last=|first=|date=|website=www.varzesh3.com|access-date=2019-01-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.the-afc.com/img/image/upload/fwfvmb8vhawhxcm5zqtw.pdf|title=The AFC|last=|first=|date=|website=www.the-afc.com|language=en-GB|access-date=2019-01-21}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Damash=== Jahanbakhsh played most of his youth in Rasht and Persian Qazvin before joining the youth academy of [[Damash Gilan]] in 2008. Jahanbaksh started his career in 2010 with [[Parseh Tehran F.C.|Damash Tehran]], an affiliate of Damash Gilan in the [[Iran Football's 2nd Division|2nd Division]]. In 2011, Alireza returned to Gilan and at the age of 17. In 2011, Jahanbakhsh played his first game for [[Damash Gilan]] in the [[Persian Gulf Pro League|Iran Pro League]] against [[Sanat Mes Kerman F.C.|Mes]] as one of Damash's youngest ever players.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iplstats.com/website11-12/Week06/DGL_MES_06.htm|title=Iranian Premier League Stats: 2011-2012 Season|accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |author=Saleh Doosti |url=http://www.anglechronicle.com/alireza-jahanbakhsh-thrilled-after-being-called-into-iran-squad/240 |title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh Thrilled After Being Called Into Iran Squad | Angle Chronicle - Part 240 |work=Angle Chronicle |date=25 February 2014 |accessdate=12 August 2014 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140508004925/http://www.anglechronicle.com/alireza-jahanbakhsh-thrilled-after-being-called-into-iran-squad/240 |archive-date=8 May 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Alireza scored his first goal on 15 January 2012 in a 1–0 victory against [[Fajr Sepasi Shiraz F.C.|Fajr]]. In 42 league appearances with Damash, he scored 10 goals.
===NEC=== ====2013–14 season==== On 26 May 2013, Jahanbakhsh reached a verbal agreement with Dutch [[Eredivisie]] outfit [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]] for a three-year deal. This deal was subject to a medical examination and obtaining a visa and work permit.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/home/07425_n-e-c-bereikt-mondelinge-overeenkomst-met-iranier-jahanbakhsh |title=NEC bereikt mondelinge overeenkomst met Iraniër Jahanbakhsh |publisher=Nec-nijmegen.nl |accessdate=12 August 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141231205201/http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/home/07425_n-e-c-bereikt-mondelinge-overeenkomst-met-iranier-jahanbakhsh |archive-date=31 December 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.persianleague.com/the-news/1-latest-news/7739-alireza-jahanbakhsh-joins-the-dutch-premier-league-eredivisie-photo.html |title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh joins the Dutch premier league (Eredivisie) VIDEO+PHOTO |publisher=Persianleague.com |date=31 May 2013 |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> He officially joined the club on 1 July 2013. He made his debut as a substitute in a league match against [[FC Groningen|Groningen]] on 3 August 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/match?gameId=367133|title=NEC Nijmegen vs. FC Groningen - Football Match Report |publisher=ESPN |date=3 August 2013 |accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal in an 8–0 win over [[Harkemase Boys]] in the [[2013–14 KNVB Cup|KNVB Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2013/09/24/jahanbakhsh-scores-maiden-goal-in-the-netherlands/ |title=Jahanbakhsh scores maiden goal in the Netherlands [VIDEO] |publisher=Persianfootball.com |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> On 1 December 2013, Jahanbakhsh scored two goals and assisted the other in a 3–2 league match win over [[AZ Alkmaar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2013/12/01/alireza-jahanbakhsh-scores-a-brace-assists-one/ |title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh scores a brace, assists one [VIDEO] |publisher=Persianfootball.com |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> On 22 December, he scored and assisted at [[FC Groningen]] while providing a secondary assist on 15 February 2014 against RKC Waalwijk. On 22 March, when NEC were down 2–0 at halftime, Jahanbakhsh came on as a substitute after the half and provided an assist to [[Michael Higdon]] in their 2–2 draw at [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/football/eredivisie/2013-2014/sc-heerenveen-nec-620363.html |title=sc Heerenveen v NEC | Eredivisie 2013-2014 - Yahoo Eurosport UK |publisher=Yahoo! |date=22 March 2014 |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref>
On the final day of the [[2013–14 Eredivisie|2013–14 season]], Jahanbakhsh scored two late goals against [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] to save NEC from automatic relegation, instead securing a relegation playoff spot.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/news/2014/May/03/eredivisie-wrap-roda-down-despite-victory-psv-gain-fourth/n284311/ |title=Eredivisie Wrap: Roda down despite victory, PSV gain fourth |publisher=Soccerway |date=3 May 2014 |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11913/9296098/eredivisie-nec-nijmegen-beat-ajax-to-survive-roda-relegated |title=Eredivisie: NEC Nijmegen beat Ajax to survive, Roda relegated |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/world-match-centre/nationalleagues/nationalleague=netherlands-eredivisie-2000000022/news/newsid/233/322/0/ |title=NEC face play-off, Roda relegated |publisher=FIFA |date=5 August 2014 |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> Alireza was originally voted the Eredivisie's greatest talent of the season before becoming runner-up to [[Memphis Depay]].<ref name="greatesttalent">{{cite web |url=http://www.bestevoetballers.nl/ranking/grootste-talent-eredivisie-2013-2014 |title=Grootste talent 2013-2014 |publisher=Bestevoetballers.nl |date=1 April 2012 |accessdate=12 August 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140804033626/http://www.bestevoetballers.nl/ranking/grootste-talent-eredivisie-2013-2014 |archive-date=4 August 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.teammelli.com/2014/05/23/jahanbakhsh-voted-best-young-talent-in-the-netherlands/ |title=Jahanbakhsh voted best young talent in the Netherlands. |publisher=TeamMelli |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15 season==== On the opening day of the [[2014–15 Eerste Divisie|2014–15 Jupiler League]], Jahanbakhsh scored a goal in a 3–1 win against [[FC Eindhoven]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2014/08/10/jahanbakhsh-scores-in-necs-jupiler-league-opener/ |title=Jahanbakhsh scores in NEC's Jupiler League opener |publisher=Persianfootball.com |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> On 29 August, he scored two goals and provided two assists in a 4–1 win at [[Helmond Sport]].<ref>{{cite web|title=NEC heeft alles weer op een rijtje in Helmond|url=https://www.bndestem.nl/overig/nec-heeft-alles-weer-op-een-rijtje-in-helmond~a180a106/|website=www.bndestem.nl|language=nl}}</ref> On 20 September, he scored against [[FC Emmen]] to help bring NEC to the top of the league table.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.omroepgelderland.nl/web/nieuws-1/2069969/simpele-zege-nec-op-zwak-emmen-40.htm#.VB5WUPldWSo |title=Archived copy |access-date=21 September 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006070630/http://www.omroepgelderland.nl/web/nieuws-1/2069969/simpele-zege-nec-op-zwak-emmen-40.htm#.VB5WUPldWSo#.VB5WUPldWSo |archive-date=6 October 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Three days later, on 23 September, AJ scored a [[Direct free kick|free kick]] in extra time and converted a penalty in their win against [[AFC Ajax (amateurs)|Ajax II]] at [[Amsterdam]] during the second round of the [[2014–15 KNVB Cup|2014–15 Dutch Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.omroepgelderland.nl/web/nieuws-1/2070224/nec-komt-met-schrik-vrij-bij-amateurs-ajax.htm|title=NEC komt met schrik vrij bij amateurs Ajax}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kmhIU1GGg5g&t=58s|title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh goal against Jong Ajax|last=A Avesta|date=24 September 2014|via=YouTube}}</ref> On 3 October, he scored a goal and provided an assist in a 2–1 win against [[Almere City FC|Almere City]] to send NEC to the [[2014–15 Eredivisie#Play-offs|Eredivisie play-offs]] as quarter-season league champions.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jupilerleague.nl/nieuws/816-eerste-bronzen-stier-naar-nijmegen |publisher=JupilerLeague.nl |language=Dutch |access-date=3 October 2014 |date=3 October 2014 |title=Eerste Bronzen Stier naar Nijmegen |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006071058/http://www.jupilerleague.nl/nieuws/816-eerste-bronzen-stier-naar-nijmegen |archive-date=6 October 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2014/10/04/jahanbahksh-leads-nec-to-promotion-playoff/|title=Jahanbahksh leads NEC to promotion playoff [VIDEO]|website=persianfootball.com}}</ref> On 17 October 2014, Jahanbakhsh was named the Best Player of the First Period of the [[2014–15 Eerste Divisie|2014–15 Jupiler League]].<ref name="bronzebull">{{cite web|url=http://www.elfvoetbal.nl/nieuws/379723_jahanbakhsh-beste-speler-jupiler-league|title=Jahanbakhsh beste speler Jupiler League |language=nl |date=18 October 2014|publisher=elfvoetbal.nl}}</ref>
On 28 November, he opened the scoring with a [[Volley (football)|volley]] and provided two assists in a 5–1 win over [[Jong FC Twente|Jong Twente]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101188_n-e-c-vs-jong-twente |title=Archived copy |access-date=30 November 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150215000240/http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101188_n-e-c-vs-jong-twente |archive-date=15 February 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> On 1 February 2015, in his first game upon his return from the [[2015 AFC Asian Cup]], he scored a [[bicycle kick]] and was named [[man of the match]] in the 3–1 win over [[Helmond Sport]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101201_n-e-c-vs-helmond-sport|title=N.E.C. wint met 3-1 thuis van Helmond Sport|access-date=1 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150203212600/http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101201_n-e-c-vs-helmond-sport|archive-date=3 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/bibliotheek/interviews/10855_n-e-c-tv-reacties-ruud-brood-en-alireza-jahanbakhsh-na-n-e-c-helmond-sport|title=N.E.C. TV: Reacties Ruud Brood en Alireza Jahanbakhsh na N.E.C.-Helmond Sport|access-date=1 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150214235823/http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/bibliotheek/interviews/10855_n-e-c-tv-reacties-ruud-brood-en-alireza-jahanbakhsh-na-n-e-c-helmond-sport|archive-date=14 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 13 February, he scored a goal and provided two assists in a 3–2 win over [[FC Emmen]] with another goal against [[Achilles '29]] days later to bring his tally to 4 goals in 5 consecutive matches after the Asian Cup.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101206_fc-emmen-vs-n-e-c|title=N.E.C. sleept overwinning uit het vuur in Emmen|access-date=14 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150214232957/http://www.nec-nijmegen.nl/seizoen/wedstrijden/101206_fc-emmen-vs-n-e-c|archive-date=14 February 2015|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2015/02/14/jahanbakhsh-shines-dejagah-ezatolahi-score/|title=Jahanbakhsh shines, Dejagah, Ezatolahi score|website=persianfootball.com}}</ref>
At the end of the season, Jahanbakhsh was selected by fans as NEC's player of the season.<ref>https://scontent-ams.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xap1/v/t1.0-9/11202954_827741697302688_5957564583891315961_n.jpg?oh=1cbf2281ba732e0f1b7630e3916b27f4&oe=55D419D5{{Dead link|date=October 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> On 12 May 2015 Jahanbakhsh was voted as the Eerste Divisie's best player for the 2014–15 season, with twelve goals and eighteen assists in the league.<ref name="footballitarin.com">{{cite web|url=http://footballitarin.com/link_page.php?id=221558|title=فوتبالی‌ترین - جهانبخش بهترین بازیکن لیگ یک هلند شناخته شد|website=footballitarin.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jahanbakhsh wint Gouden Stier, De Jong beste trainer|url=https://www.vi.nl/nieuws/jahanbakhsh-wint-gouden-stier-de-jong-beste-trainer|website=www.vi.nl|language=nl}}</ref>
===AZ=== ====2015–16 season==== On 3 August 2015, Jahanbakhsh signed a five–year contract with Dutch club [[AZ Alkmaar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.voetbalzone.nl/doc.asp?uid=252227|title=AZ haalt Jahanbakhsh voor vijf jaar naar Alkmaar}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=AZ akkoord over Jahanbakhsh - AZ|url=https://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-akkoord-over-jahanbakhsh/1?catid=|website=www.az.nl|language=nl}}</ref> He was given number nine as his jersey number, and made his [[Eredivisie]] debut for AZ on 12 September 2015 in a 3–1 win over [[De Graafschap]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.az.nl/en/news/az-secure-first-eredivisie-win-at-de-vijverberg/7?catid=1834|title=AZ secure first Eredivisie win at De Vijverberg - AZ|website=az.nl}}</ref> Jahanbakhsh made his [[UEFA Europa League]] debut in a 2–1 [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League#Group L|group stage]] win over [[Athletic Bilbao]] on 1 October 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000658/match=2016970/index.html|title=UEL - Matches|last=UEFA.com|publisher=UEFA}}</ref> Alireza recorded his first assist for AZ on 21 November 2015 in a 3–1 victory against [[SC Heerenveen|Heerenveen]]. Jahanbakhsh scored his first goal for AZ on 30 January 2016 in a match against his former club [[NEC Nijmegen|NEC]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.azfanpage.nl/wedstrijden/12512/ |title=Archived copy |access-date=6 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160207115947/http://www.azfanpage.nl/wedstrijden/12512/ |archive-date=7 February 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He scored his second goal of the season and also recorded his fourth assist on 13 February 2016 in a 6–3 victory over [[Heracles Almelo]].
====2016–17 season==== In June 2016 Jahanbakhsh switched from number 9 to number 7 for the upcoming 2016–17 season.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.varzesh3.com/news/1336243/شماره-7-به-علیرضا-جهانبخش-رسید|title=شماره 7 به علیرضا جهانبخش رسید|trans-title=Number 7 will be given to Jahanbakhsh.|publisher=Varzesh 3|language=Persian|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref> On 2 July 2016, in AZ's first preseason match, Jahanbakhsh recorded a goal and an assist in his teams 5–1 victory. On 28 August he scored his first goal of the season against [[FC Utrecht]]. The match was ended 2-1 which Jahanbakhsh scored the winning goal.
On 13 January 2017, Jahanbakhsh scored a brace and recorded an assist, as well as being named man of the match in a 3–1 victory against [[Go Ahead Eagles]]. On 21 August 2016, he scored his first goal of the season in a 2–1 win over newly promoted [[FC Utrecht|Utrecht]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/match?gameId=451135|title=FC Utrecht 1–2 AZ Alkmaar |date=21 August 2016 |publisher=ESPN}}</ref> On 16 February 2017, he scored his first ever [[UEFA|European]] goal in a 4–1 loss to [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]] in Round of 32 of the [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/history/season=2017/matches/round=2000793/match=2019655/index.html |title=AZ v Lyon|date=16 February 2017|publisher=UEFA|accessdate=15 July 2018}}</ref>
Jahanbakhsh was named the best winger of the 2016–17 season in the Dutch League.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.foxsports.nl/nieuws/artikel/1886458/top-beste-vleugelaanvallers|title=Top 5: De beste buitenspelers|website=foxsports.nl}}</ref>
====2017–18 season==== [[File:BHA v FC Nantes pre season 03 08 2018-287 (43135243974).jpg|thumb|Jahanbakhsh in a pre-match warmup with Brighton in August 2018]] Alireza scored a hat trick and recorded an assist on 18 April 2018 against Vitesse in the [[2017–18 Eredivisie]].<ref>{{cite web|title=AZ Alkmaar 4-3 Vitesse - Eredivisie 2017/2018 Live|url=https://www.whoscored.com/Matches/1189309/Live/Netherlands-Eredivisie-2017-2018-AZ-Alkmaar-Vitesse|language=en}}</ref> Jahanbakhsh scored another hat trick on the last match day to become the leading goal scorer of the Eredivisie season with 21 goals, and also finished joint third with 12 assists.<ref name="foxsportsasia.com"/> He became the first Asian player ever to become the top goalscorer in a top level European league.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2018/05/07/1719089/alireza-jahanbakhsh-wins-eredivisie-golden-boot|title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh Wins Eredivisie Golden Boot|publisher=[[Tasnim News Agency]]|date=7 May 2018|accessdate=30 May 2018}}</ref>
===Brighton & Hove Albion=== On 25 July 2018, Jahanbakhsh transferred to [[Premier League]] side [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] for an undisclosed club record fee, signing a five-year contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/july/albion-sign-iran-international-for-club-record-fee/|title=ALBION SIGN IRAN INTERNATIONAL FOR CLUB RECORD FEE|publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref> He announced on his [[Instagram]] that he will wear number 16, the same number he used to wear in his first season at [[N.E.C. (football club)|NEC]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.tarafdari.com/node/1052191|title=علیرضا جهانبخش پیراهن شماره 16 برایتون را بر تن خواهد کرد|trans-title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh will wear number 16 at Brighton|date=7 August 2018|access-date=12 August 2018|publisher=Tarafdari|language=Persian}}</ref>
On 11 August 2018, Jahanbakhsh made his debut for Brighton as a substitute in the club's opening match of the [[Premier League]] season against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45067369|title=Watford 2–0 Brighton|publisher=BBC Spor|date=11 August 2018|access-date=12 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Iran vs. Montenegro 2014-05-26 (125).jpg|thumb|200px|Jahanbakhsh playing for [[Iran national football team|Iran]] in a friendly match against [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]], 26 May 2014]]
===Youth=== Jahanbakhsh was part of the squad that played at the [[2010 AFC U-19 Championship]] in China, playing in two games. Being only 16 at the start of the championships in 2010, he continued at the same age group, captaining the [[Iran national under-20 football team|national under-20 team]] for their successful [[2012 AFC U-19 Championship qualification]] by scoring 5 goals in four appearances. At the [[2012 AFC U-19 Championship|championships]], he added two more to his tally against the [[United Arab Emirates national football team|United Arab Emirates]] and [[South Korea national football team|South Korea]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11065/9289258/world-cup-scout |title=World Cup Scout |work=Sky Sports |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref>
Jahanbakhsh was called into [[Iran national under-23 football team|Iran's]] [[Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics|Olympic]] [[2016 AFC U-23 Championship qualification|qualifiers]] in March 2015 and was named team [[Captain (association football)|captain]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2015/03/14/azmoun-and-jahanbakhsh-invited-to-olympic-football-team/|title=Azmoun and Jahanbakhsh Invited to Olympic Football Team|website=persianfootball.com}}</ref> With the presence of Jahanbakhsh the under-23 team qualified to the [[2016 AFC U-23 Championship]] in [[Qatar]]. As the [[2016 AFC U-23 Championship]] was not held during the [[FIFA International Match Calendar]], Jahanbakhsh was not released by AZ Alkmaar.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.the-afc.com/ir-iran-afc-u-23-championship-2016/blow-for-iran-as-nourollahi-ruled-out-of-afc-u23-championship|title=The AFC.com - The Asian Football Confederation|website=the-afc.com}}</ref>
===Senior team=== [[File:Alireza Jahanbakhsh in Iran national football team 2018.jpg|thumb|left|Alireza Jahanbakhsh playing for [[Iran national football team|Iran]] in a friendly match against [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]], 2018]] On 5 October 2013, Jahanbakhsh was called up to [[Iran national football team|Team Melli]] in a [[2015 AFC Asian Cup qualification#Group B|2015 Asian Cup qualifier]] against [[Thailand national football team|Thailand]] by manager [[Carlos Queiroz]], and he served his first cap as a substitute in the 82nd minute.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.varzesh3.com/news.do?itemid=1024184&title=%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%8A_%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B2%D9%8A%DA%A9%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86_%D8%AA%D9%8A%D9%85_%D9%85%D9%84%D9%8A_%D9%81%D9%88%D8%AA%D8%A8%D8%A7%D9%84_%D8%A7%D8%B9%D9%84%D8%A7%D9%85_%D8%B4%D8%AF |title=Queiroz announced Team Melli players for Thailand match |publisher=Varzesh3.com |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/iran/news/1825/%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86/2013/10/05/4312122/%DA%AF%D8%B2%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%B4-%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%B2-%D8%A8%D9%87-%DA%AF%D9%86%DA%AF-%D8%AF%D9%88-%D9%85%D9%84%DB%8C%D8%AA%DB%8C-%D9%87%D8%A7-%D8%AE%D9%88%D8%B4-%D8%A2%D9%85%D8%AF%DB%8C%D8%AF-%D8%A8%DB%8C%D8%AA-%D8%A2%D8%B4%D9%88%D8%B1-%D8%A2%D8%AE%D8%B1%DB%8C%D9%86-%D8%AE%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%AC%DB%8C?ICID=OP |title=Jahanbakhsh invited to the Iran national team |publisher=Goal.com |accessdate=12 August 2014}}</ref> His first national team goal came in his second game on 15 November in a 3–0 win at Thailand.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/match?id=364938&cc=5901 |title=Match: Thailand v Iran – AFC Asian Cup Qualifiers |publisher=[[ESPN FC]] |date=15 November 2013 |accessdate=20 April 2014}}</ref> On 1 June 2014, he was called into [[Iran national football team|Iran's]] [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] squad by [[Carlos Queiroz]].<ref name="2014wcsquad">{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=quieroz-trims-squad-to-24-2351854.html |title=Queiroz trims Iran squad to 24 |date=1 June 2014 |accessdate=1 June 2014 |publisher=FIFA |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140601164415/http://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y%3D2014/m%3D6/news%3Dquieroz-trims-squad-to-24-2351854.html |archivedate=1 June 2014 }}</ref> He played in all three matches against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]], [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] and [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]]. He was called into Iran's [[2015 AFC Asian Cup]] squad on 30 December 2014 by Queiroz.<ref name="2015acsquad">{{cite web|url=http://www.afcasiancup.com/news/en/nekounam-headlines-iranian-squad/10ppu97hz8lxf1ik1ux49b1ve0 |title=Queiroz Names Team Melli Squad |date=30 December 2014 |publisher=afcasiancup.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150101072926/http://www.afcasiancup.com/news/en/nekounam-headlines-iranian-squad/10ppu97hz8lxf1ik1ux49b1ve0 |archivedate=1 January 2015 }}</ref>
[[File:Alireza Jahanbakhsh T1.jpg|thumb|Jahanbakhsh in Iran training before [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]] Jahanbakhsh scored Iran's second goal in June 2016 in a 2–0 World Cup qualifier victory against [[Qatar national football team|Qatar]].
In May 2018, he was named in Iran's [[Iran national football team|squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44357568|title=World Cup 2018: Iran head coach Carlos Queiroz names final squad|date=4 June 2018|work=BBC Sport|access-date=9 June 2018|language=en-GB}}</ref> He played all three group matches against [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]], [[Spain national football team|Spain]] and [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]].
In December 2018, Jahanbakhsh was selected for [[2019 AFC Asian Cup squads#Iran|Iran's 23-man squad]] for the [[2019 AFC Asian Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.persianfootball.com/news/2018/12/26/queiroz-names-final-23-for-asian-cup/|title=Queiroz names final 23 for Asian Cup|publisher=Persian Football|first=Martin|last=Reza Babry|date=26 December 2018|accessdate=21 January 2019}}</ref> On 16 January 2019, he made his competitive debut in a 0–0 draw against [[Iraq national football team|Iraq]] in the last match of the group stage.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.tarafdari.com/node/1196650|title=قسمت جذاب ترکیب کی روش؛ جهانبخش وارد می‌شود (عکس)|trans-title=The interesting part of Quieroz's squad; Jahanbakhsh enters|publisher=Tarafdari|language=Persian|date=17 January 2019|accessdate=21 January 2019}}</ref> In the latter match, he scored his first goal in the tournament in the 2–0 victory against [[Oman national football team|Oman]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.the-afc.com/asiancup/news/round-of-16-ir-iran-2-0-oman|publisher=AFC|date=20 January 2019|accessdate=21 January 2019}}</ref>
==Style of play== Jahanbakhsh has been compared to Iranian legend [[Mehdi Mahdavikia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/sg/features/alireza-jahanbakhsh-eye-catching-iranian-name-and-style|title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh: The eye-catching Iranian, in name and style|date=26 April 2016}}</ref> He has been praised for his assisting ability and has been described as a technically gifted player who is able to use both feet.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-4458984/Watford-Bournemouth-Burnley-chase-9m-Iran-winger.html#comments|title=Watford, Bournemouth and Burnley lead chase for £9m-rated Iran winger}}</ref> In Holland, Jahanbakhsh established himself as a dangerous and pacy player.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gelderlander.nl/vitesse/toptip-voor-de-finale-ali-en-rickygoal~aab4e34c/|title=Cookies op gelderlander.nl - gelderlander.nl|website=gelderlander.nl}}</ref> In several interviews Jahanbakhsh revealed his life time dream is to play in [[Bundesliga]], although there is huge interest in him from Italian and English sides declaring that as a kid he grew up watching his idols [[Ali Daei]], [[Ali Karimi]] and [[Vahid Hashemian]] play for [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] and Mehdi Mahdavikia for [[Hamburger SV]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tehrantimes.com/news/421461/It-s-my-dream-to-play-in-Bundesliga-Alireza-Jahanbakhsh/|title=It's my dream to play in Bundesliga: Alireza Jahanbakhsh|date=21 February 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.tasnimnews.com/en/news/2018/02/22/1663777/iran-s-alireza-jahanbakhsh-on-napoli-s-radar-report/|title=Iran's Alireza Jahanbakhsh on Napoli's Radar: Report - Tasnim News Agency}}</ref>
==Outside football== ===Sponsorship=== Jahanbakhsh is outfitted by German sportswear manufacturer [[Adidas]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.footballbootsdb.com/player/Alireza-Jahanbakhsh/59589|title=Alireza Jahanbakhsh Football Boots|website=Football Boots Database}}</ref>
